description:
One of the best experiences I've had in China Town! Service is quick, food is phenomenal, and you definitely get your money's worth. Usually I go with two of my friends and we order the sesame chicken, sizzling rice soup, side of rice, and calamari. Always leave with leftovers! I definitely recommend the Detoxifying fruit (hot) tea. 
The atmosphere is great, you are however really close to other parties though, it's quite a fun experience!
author: Heather W.

description:
Wow so good 
Came here on a recommendation from Hotel 
I'm very picky on Chinese and this was great
They have a few things not on menu so ask
Can't wait to come back
author: Vicki K.

description: No longer the quality of food that was worth waiting in line for.  Came here last week-- the sesame chicken was all crust and goopy sauce-- barely any chicken in the dish.  The calamari is now breaded, when it used to be simply tenderized in a tasty sauce, and even though we requested steamed egg rolls, the order came with crusty deep fried egg rolls with hardly any filling.  The service was never friendly, but in years past, the food made up for that.  Now you get mediocre food and rude service, with the sense that they just want to rush you in and out.  We live in the neighborhood.  Look elsewhere.
author: Anne C.

description: Excellent food. The sesame chicken was incredible and had great flavor. It was served with sweet potatoes and an unnamed green vegetable...would love to know what this is. The house noodles were great, loved the pea shoots on top. Lastly, the pork wonton soup with sizzling rice was refreshing and fragrant. Loved all the food. The service was quick, but not very welcoming. Didn't really bother me, but it's worth noting.
author: Delaney F.

description:
Hands down my favorite place for dumplings! 

We came in & were sat immediately! I was so happy that they weren't that busy considering that it was a Saturday night. We ordered Shrimp packets to start. Really crisp & delicious. We also ordered Pork & Chicken dumplings. They were so so so soft. Exactly what I wanted & expected. The flavor of the sauce that it came with was also really tasty. The only thing that bummed me out was the Sesame chicken! The chicken was good, but the dish was mostly yams covered with sauce. I felt like the name of the dish should be "Sesame Yams". But those dumplings earned 5 stars on their own. Can't wait to come back!
author: Nikki S.

description: As a visitor from the outside looking in I almost feel unworthy to be reviewing a Chinese restaurant in Chinatown. However we certainly enjoyed our lunch here. There was nothing that blew us away, but we recognized the food as just really good food. The pork dumplings were scrumptious, I really liked the sauce as it was on the sweeter side and took the edge off the saltiness of the soy sauce. The house egg noodles were good, simple and filling, and made for a good rice substitution while eating the sesame chicken. The sesame chicken was definitely worth ordering. They do the batter right as it's not too much nor too little too give it that satisfying crunch. The sauce is one of the better sauces I've had. I only wish I had another stomach to try their other dishes.
author: David K.

description:
Sesame chicken and garlic beef were amazing! Service was "Soup Nazi"-ish, but the food was really good.

Seating is very tight, I'd recommend groups of no more than 4 or you'll probably have a bit of a wait.
author: CJ T.

description:
Good spot on the outskirts of Chinatown. Plenty of space in comparison to most of the places in the area, so it's easy to bring a group without a reservation. We went at 12pm on a Sunday and didn't have to wait at all.  

We got the Chow Mein and Tofu in Black bean sauce. The Chow mein was good, but a bit greasier than I would have liked. The Tofu in Black Bean was very different and delicious! The sauce was very unique, and the tofu was well prepared with a crisp fry. 

3 stars because it was greasy. But it was good and I wouldn't mind going back.
author: Dimple B.

description:
Pretty unsanitary. People love the food here but its super unclean. Wouldnt do it again.

Staff touch the utensils, chopsticks are poorly stored and staff touch them all over before handing them to you. If you get a dish that requires a garnish on top the server will apply the garnish with bare hands before bringing the dish. Multiple servers hold bowls and plates on the way to the table with their thumbs in the food. 

Basically their hands will be all over your food and utensils. Disgusting, wouldn't recommend it, wouldn't do it again.
author: H R.

description: Great food at a great price. However the service was not that great. I had to flag our waiter twice for water refills and was then rushed to sign our receipt after already paying with my credit card. I wanted to enjoy my food but the waiter would not go away from our table till I signed my credit card receipt. Honestly wish he would've been a little more patient as we were with our refills. Still love the food so we'll be back, just wish upper management knew how their employees are when the employees are running the restaurant on their own.
author: Andy G.

description: Please do not give this place the benefit of the doubt. I was pretty excited to come here seeing a whole bunch of positive Yelp reviews. I was EXTREMELY dissatisfied as it was very dirty, staff was super unfriendly and impatient, and it smelt like raw chicken (I could hear them chopping bones in the kitchen which I wouldn't mind if the smell didn't make it's way to the dining area). Last but not least, the food was was my least favorite Chinese I've ever had.
author: Sharah M.

description: Perfect service.  Five of us rolled in and the waitress asked if she should just hook us up.  We said yes, she grabbed the menus and took us on a whirlwind ride of very good food.  Pork potstickers, maybe the best ever.  Fried egg plant, amazing.  Some fish dish with greens, awesome.  Fried rice (my request), so so so good.  Sesame chicken was very good.  The pork and beef dishes weren't my thing.  The others liked the pork dish.  The beef dish was just too fatty for me; completely a personal preference thing (I tend to like lean).  We all are way too much, but it was just so damn good.
author: T A.

description: My review is similar to a review I read before my trip, but I had go back one last time to see for myself.  Discovered this place in the 90s...  Was one of my favorite restaurants in the WORLD and have been back over a dozen times thru the years.  But things change.  Ordered my 2 favorites; the pot stickers with peanut sauce & chow mein.  The recipes were totally different, and boy, were they awful!  The food made this place special; those days are gone. Now it seems like just another Chinese restaurant.  Never going back.  And oy, the prices now!
author: Tim G.

description: Won ton soup was the best I've ever had. Sesame chicken was fantastic. Also had the house noodles. All great. Expect Asian style service, its not bad-just a different culture. Overall highly reccomend.
author: Sasha B.

description: My mom got me take out from here. I don't understand what the hype is.. She got me wonton soup.. It tasted like crap. She got me shrimp and tofu.. No taste and mango chicken that's pure spicy.. And not much tender or chicken taste. I pretty disappointed by this place. Though I really wanted to try their fried rice, it looks pretty good !!
author: Amy Y.

description: Great food! We let the staff order for us since we were from out of town.  It was a bit to much food for us. I would stick to a few popular dishes. You will enjoy the food more and your wallet won't suffer as much
author: Lizabeth A.

description: The food s not great. It probably falls into the stereotype of Chinese food. That's what makes it so popular ?
author: Zekia Z.

description: They bring you menus but ask if you've been there before. If so, they take the menus away and bring on the food. Yummy green beans, honey beef with bok Choy, pot sticker that are yummy!!! Apples  and shrimp and sesame chicken. Also a fish dish with greens. all so tasty no need for soy sauce or chili sauce.  Service is prompt and efficient. No real conversation.  The flower tea is uniquely served in beer mugs so that you can see the flower open. Not cheap. $114 for 5 of us before tip. But very tasty food. We will be back.
author: Randi M.

description:
This was the second time I visited House of Nanking. Last time I came here was a few years ago, and the experience was not so good. So, I thought I gave it a try this time when my friend suggested coming. 

Overall, we were pretty disappointed. We ordered onion pancake and pork egg rolls for appetizer. I liked both of the dishes and thought they were unique. We had house fried rice, fried calamari, and one vegetable dish to share. First of all, the fried rice doesn't have the ingredients that were described on the menu (no zucchini, eggplant, sweet potato), and it tasted plain. Second, the fried calamari was saggy and sitting in the lemon flavored sauce. Lastly, the vegetable didn't look appetizing as there were only a few pieces on the plate sitting in some sauce.

I think I wouldn't try House of Nanking again because of the two bad experiences.
author: Jamie C.

description:
House of Nanking is famous and is famous for a few of their dishes. 
I love most everything I have had here. 

If you come in the evening or even during the day at times be prepared to order quickly. 
You will feel like you are being rushed to get out so Someone else can come in... And it's true. 
There is often a line and you will be treated essentially like a number and they want you in and out.  Hence the 4 star instead of 5. 

Other than that, great food.
author: Greg F.

description: Just so there's no confusion, the Chinese food here is Americanized.  It's a bit of a tourist trap.  The food is lathered in sauce, and things are too sweet and too salty.  We got a beef and cabbage dish, and I honestly could not taste the beef or cabbage.  Finally, the place is understaffed and overcrowded.  Expect to be sitting elbow-to-elbow with other guests.
author: Simon G.

description:
VERY vegan and vegetarian friendly and the food was insanely good. Try their blossoming flower tea served in a big stein. It's beautiful.

Service was fast and no-nonsense but that's to be expected in Chinatown. Will definitely return when we visit San Francisco again.
author: C F.

description: By far the best Chinese place I've eaten at. It's great. Family style seating. But the food quality is phenomenal.
author: Chris S.

description: Very authentic and incredible fresh food! Small first area and an extended second area of seating. Waiters attitudes are hit or miss, but I always end up going back. Must get the flower tea!
author: Bryn C.

description:
I come here whenever I'm in town and the service is good I really don't know where the complaints come from.  You get what you give.
Mr Fang always has a smile on his face and loves to choose your order for you if you let him.  He does not disappoint.
The market greens, sizzling rice soup, salt & pepper shrimp, and Nanking beef are my favorite dishes.
author: Robert F.

description: I love this place. I would drive from the O.C. to S.F. just for their Wonton  soup. Everything else on the menu is good too depending on your craving for the day. The service is less to be desire for, but hey it is a chinese restaurant.
author: Cyn L.

description: We have been coming for years. The service is a zero. The food comes out fast. The menu is small. The sesame chicken and chow mein are good. The onion pancake is good for starter. Food tastes greasy but hey it's Chinese. Lines can be long. It's an institution in Chinatown.
author: Jim A.

description: Great food. My son and I had pan-fried five spiced pork chops, crispy rice noodle tower with beef, chow mein, fried onioncakes, steamed pork dumpling, and I had Tsingtao beer. A lot to eat but ate most of it. then spinted to top of Nob Hill. Highly recommended.
author: Eric J.

description: Came in with a group of 8 and the owner said "I'll take care of you" and commenced to bring us a variety of house specialties.  Ribs, fried mushrooms, shrimp, fish, on and on....so good!
author: Stacy E.

description: Food was great! Bau Bing Beef is delicious as well as their Famous Sesame Chicken. Service was very quick!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
ZERO stars!!  Having come here for years, tonight will be the last.  Absolutely the worst and rudest service from the moment we walked in. Then - a mix up in the kitchen of two of our four  orders led to a most unique and ridiculous scene I've ever experienced. The manager, after we (myself, wife and two daughters) politely wished to discuss why the honey beef became the garlic beef and why the honey shrimp became the mayonnaise shrimp (the waiter late told me the honey was mayonnaise and sugar) proceeded to literally argue rudely and put her fingers into my daughter's dinner, picking out the shrimp one by one-- with her fingers. When we indicated we would not be paying for the dish, she began shouting at us, with a restaurant full of customers.  She claimed since we had already eaten all of the shrimp we must have liked it. We tried three (my daughter my wife and myself).   The dish was disgusting but the service was worse.  Overall the wait staff was horrible, but as we left no fewer than four staff apologized to us.    

My days at Nan King are done and I would encourage any and all to try somewhere else.  Even if this was an aberration, no customer should ever be treated this way.
author: Mark R.

description: Disgusting customer service. Lady at the counter walked away from me twice and refused to acknowledge me when I was asking for help after I had paid for a meal unknowingly at their other restaurant. I have had great food here and recommended it to many people in the past but unfortunately will no longer recommend or visit this place. She knows it's a tourist destination so clearly didn't care.
author: Kenny C.

description: This food is incredible. After reading the reviews I was expecting terrible service, but we found the staff to be really helpful in ordering and the food came fast and with smiles.  I would definitely eat here again.  It was incredible.
author: Shay R.

description:
We came here with extremely high expectations and got shot down. 
We got the Sesame chicken, Beijing beef, chow mein and pork egg roll. 
Pork egg roll= while it had a good outside sauce and crispy texture, there was WAY too much pork to fit inside that tiny little roll and was a bit too chewy for my liking. 
Chow mein= this was my favorite part of the dish, but came off just a bit too salty for some of the people in my party
Sesame chicken= this "famous dish" will forever live in my mind as the dish with the plastic in it, yes you read right. Plastic. If you dare to get it after this review PLEASE inspect the meat for any unsavory plastic bits. 
Beijing beef= no flavor, just spice
All and I wouldn't come back here in the future
author: Corissa G.

description: One of the most authentic Chinese restaurants in San Francisco.
author: Yurena G.

description:
Hands down the best Chinese food I have ever had in my life! I ate here last year while attending The Dreamforce convention in November. I was floored with how good the food was.. I came back here this year for Dreamforce with some in trepidation.. Afraid that house of Nanking could not live up to my hype! I'm happy to say that it crushed my expectations!! 

The food is simply fantastic! I have never had better!! If you are looking for world class Chinese food this is the place!!
author: Steve B.

description:
When you walk into a restaurant at 9pm on a Sunday and there's only 1 table open, you know you've found something. 2 different people recommended this place to us. 

It was the best Chinese Food I have ever had... My girlfriend had a soup with a lot of herbs in it.. Basil? It was absolutely heavenly. The Chicken fried rice was the best I've ever had. The house noodles were great too... very calm but balanced tasting. 

The service was pretty bad... The server was rude and only stopped at our table to get our order and drop off the check. But when a place is this good, there's a certain charm to it. Just yell at them from across the room, they'll come help you. The Australian guy next to us got so frustrated he went up to the server station and gave them a hard time, but how exciting. I like this place a lot.
author: Brian A.

description:
Parking near the restaurant is terrible 

I ordered a lot of food here. *** Very fast service !!!

Crispy noodle with Chicken 4.5 star
Calamari 3 star ( too much vinegar )
Sesame chicken 5 star 
Chicken Fried Rice 4 star
Chicken noodles 4star
Dumpling 3.5 star 
Beef chow min 4 star 
Shrimp Fried rice 4 star
Chicken Fried Rice 4.5 star

Overall a great place. Be prepared to stand on a line outside .. :) 

TIP for the spicy food lovers :Ask for their Chile Sauce 

Check out the photos I posted !!
author: Nash J.

description:
Solid chinese food but not the best i've had. 


3.5 stars
author: Andy S.

description:
As part of my short journey through Chinatown I stopped here for dinner.   My coworkers had raved about this place and it was a must try.   

I would say this was one of the better Chinese meals I had.   The restaurant is packed to the max during dinner time.  I walked in and there is no waiting space and was asked to wait outside until a table was ready.  

Once in I ordered steamed dumplings (reminded me of home cooking), the house special fried rice, and famous sesame chicken.   

All of these items had great flavors.  The dumplings were just like how my mom made them.   The sesame chicken was a very large portion and the sauce was great!   The house special fried rice could be great without the cabbage which made it a but soggy but still edible.   

Would definitely come back to this place next time I am in town.
author: Johnny T.

description:
Finally made it to House of Nanking after hearing so much about it from my friends. 

No this is not a fancy Asian restaurant, and the ambiance is more of a quick meal in and out thing (even though the bf and I went on "date night"). We already knew what we were getting ourselves into because 1. he'd been there before and 2. the pictures on Yelp are pretty accurate. Honestly, it was a good night to be in this kind of setting; it was cold and rainy, there was no line, and we're late eaters. We sat right away and warmed up. Although the service is not warm and inviting, they were really great about keeping the front door closed when patrons would enter/exit the restaurant. I especially appreciate this because I am ALWAYS cold.

No not everything I ate was to my liking. But the crispy rice soup was PHENOMENAL. I would go back just for that. Also, the sesame chicken was unbelievable. I know, we've all had sesame chicken at some crappy mall stand, and I was reluctant to try it for that reason, but gosh darn it this was SO FRICKIN GOOD. 

Also the pork stuffed mushrooms were good, though the pork stuffing was a little harder than I was expecting.

The crispy noodle tower was actually my least favorite of all the dishes, even though many other Yelpers rave about it. The noodles just kind of get soggy and gross, so you really have to eat them when they're crispy. 

Definitely going back for sesame chicken and crispy rice soup!
author: Kristen T.

description: sesame chicken was delicious but the rice tasted gross, it tasted like plastic.. They didnt have many options unfortunately. The people taking your order are rude. that is why i am never coming back here
author: Alexandra T.

description:
I would give five stars based on the food alone. It's very authentic and tasty! 

However, the staff? Is VERY VERY rude. All of them. It ruins the dinning experience completely. They sat my family down at a table someone else was sitting at. They gave us literally three minutes to look over the menu and came over and asked us if we were ready when I said give us two minutes she rolled her eyes and pointed at the table next to us 
"You what you want?" 
They rushed us while we ate and before we were even finished eating lunch, brought the check over. Kept rushing us to pay and literally stood next to my father until he gave him his tip. Which neither of the staff deserved. I would only recommend this place to people who are in a rush, or order to go.
author: Tanya X.

description: Just sit down and they start bringing you food. Awesome. Don't worry about dealing with the menu and just let them bring you what you'd like. We had a large group and got to have beef, pork, shrimp, calamari, and chicken. Fabulous.
author: Nickie G.

description:
I went here tonight with 3 other people. We got 5 things.  
-House noodles
-eggplant with chilli something
-steamed dumpling
and I can't remember the other 2 that we ordered. 

They were all good and the price was right. If you are drunk and hanging around that place, you should def try!!
author: C M.

description:
This is the only place I will come for Chinese on my infrequent visits to San Fran.  Both times I've been here, the server took our menus without letting us order and just said "I'll take care of you." She would bring out one dish to eat family style, and then replace it with another when we'd finished. By the end of the meal, we'd eaten a great variety of delicious food that we may not have been smart enough to order for ourselves :)

I tried another place in Chinatown last year, but it was perhaps TOO authentic for my caucasian palate. I feel like House of Nanking does a great job of giving me something I'll feel comfortable with but is definitely more exotic and authentic than Panda Express.
author: Scott G.

description:
I meant they were boring as in no flavor at all.

The two people who served us were cold and ambivalent. 

Apparently the yelp PR representative who responded above was absent that day.
author: Anna B.

description: I loved this place. Good prices. Great customer service. Food is delicious. The plates are smaller than normal family food style servings but still worth your money.
author: Vanessa S.

description: I love this place because it looks like some hole in the wall that you would rather walk by and leave to the tourists but instead it turns out to be a place with good food and highly efficient service. I've been here a couple of times now and it has been worth it each time. Only negative was that I would have liked to have had chopsticks. I'll have to remember to bring my own.
author: Erika D.

description:
If you don't eat here when you come to San Francisco, you can't come anymore.
The most AMAZING food in the city.
author: Velvel S.

description: AMAZING. Just AMAZING!!!!! food is prepared with such flavors, this is a must stop when in San Francisco. was recommended by my cousin and walked here from Banana republic and wished we were locals and come here every week and be able to try everything on the menu. WILL COME BACK!!!!!!!
author: Kirk V.

description: Let me be real for a second. This place was underwhelming. I got lost in the sauce. Servings were small, service was pleasant at best, and I wouldn't come back. Too much hype.
author: Therese C.

description: Busy place and quite small because of how packed it is. Service was alright, food came out fast and was kind of small portioned for the price! Overall it was decent and somewhat Polynesian!
author: Steven W.

description: Food was very good. It didn't matter to me that the waiter slam the chili jar down on my table and was full of attitude. The food made up for his rudeness and loudness of the screaming waiters!
author: Lolaluvs53 ..

description: I've been here a few times now.  With a large group, I love the "we will just bring you a bunch of stuff" concept.  I love the sesame chicken, the soup and the "toaster strudel looking" things.  The calamari is bland and not a fan of the fish dish.  Overall, really like this place.
author: Dustin A.

description: The food is bomb.com! I definitely will come back to this place! But the staff is rude asf! Guy, seemed annoyed! Slamming our plates on the table. Other than that good food.
author: Steven J.

description:
I came here with my family hopeful that the large amount of reviews and a passable 3.5 stars would mean that this place would be good. 

Parking in Chinatown is a disaster so be prepared to circle around for up to 30 minutes to try to find a decent parking spot. We went around 7pm and there was a decently large line (about 15-20) of people waiting to get a seat at the restaurant after talking to some people in line basically everyone has never ate at this place and were there because it seems like such a popular restaurant. 

We were seated at a table that was just cleaned off literally 20 seconds before we sat down and handed menus. Okay what everyone is saying about the service in this place is true, it is THE WORST. I don't think our server(s) said more then 5-10 words each time they stopped by our table. It seems like in this restaurant you don't have a dedicated server, but just anyone who just happens to walk by and notice your table. It honestly seemed like the staff cared more about getting people in and out to make room for the large amount of tourists that come to this restaurant. 

Prices are relatively okay with dishes around the $10-15 dollar range. We ordered the sesame chicken, calamari, house noodles, house fried rice, a spicy wonton soup, and salt and pepper squid. Honestly less than half of the dishes we ordered we considered even okay in taste. I've had a lot of Chinese food my entire life and I would rate this food as low-quality take out. Each dish we ordered came out at random times and the dishes were messy and unappealing to look at-much less eat. The worst had to be the wonton soup which came in some weird mix of rice, noodle and extremely bland soup water that looked like old dirty rice water! We did not finish a single dish more then half way. 

After we paid for our food with card and left tip in cash, one of the servers immediate went to collect the receipt and tip as we got up and actually had the audacity to ask FOR MORE TIP. Tips are something that YOU EARN, it is not a RIGHT. And the way we were treated, along with the food quality, this place did not deserve it. 

I honestly have no idea if this was just an off day or not but my dining experience at this restaurant was unforgivable and will not be giving this place another chance. 

Tl;dr
Horrible parking
Long lines to get seated
Random/rude servers
Extremely poor dining experience
Very lack-luster food
Do not come here if you want good Chinese food.
author: Anthony P.

description: This place is probably a bit over hyped by now yet the food continues to be terrific.   We just tell the waitress our preferences and let her make selections for us.    Sesame chicken was great, beef and bok choi was terrific but the pea greens were probably our favorite.
author: Matt M.

description: Simply amazing. Seated quickly even though they were packed house. Brought us drinks and water promptly. Waitress extremely happy and friendly. Excellent food, chicken is amazing. Try egggplant chicken and ask about secret menu. They wil make u anything u want. Delicious.
author: Ganja F.

description: Food was amazing and prepared quickly. Experience over all was great. My only suggestion would be to have glassware for the cups and have all the condiments (teriyaki, soy sauce) on the table. Also a little crowded with the table setting, but hey what great affordable restraint isn't?
author: Angelica G.

description: The best Chinese in SF.   Let them order for you!!!     Always a favorite when I'm in town, you won't be disappointed.   Off-peak time is recommended as lines form at times.   Worth the wait but better to avoid, in my opinion.
author: J S.

description: UNDERWHELMING. Curt service, awful calamari and ok potstickers (good peanut sauce though).  This place is riding on its good (but in no way incredible) sesame chicken.  I really don't understand where the positive reviews ate because it must be a different restaurant.
author: Steve G.

description: Continues to b weird...but food is fantastic....really good food, service is..well it's house of Na king so it's different...dont go to be wowed by service go to b blown away by the food...it's not inexpensive but I atop everytime I'm in SF...again...weird but delish
author: Bob G.

description:
I remember when this place didn't have a wait... but we didn't have to wait because we made a reservation as we were in a group.

Amazing as always... this is THE PLACE to eat Chinese food in SF
author: Scott S.

description:
Was at House of Nanking on Saturday.  Been a few times over the last five years.  First time very good then not so good the following times, a little moreso each time.

Ordered Tsingtao and potstickers.  Also ordered Diet Coke which I never got. 

Was going to order house noodles but wanted to see how good the potstickers were. There was a table behind me, the server and the diners were arguing back and forth about a dish not being right.  Yay.

Got the potstickers really fast, decent size, had a small smattering of their sweet sticky sauce on them.  Took a bite.  Really tough, almost cardboard like wrapping.  Filling was lukewarm.  Microwaved from frozen, maybe?

Decided against the house noodles and went up the street to Brandy Ho, had the best spicy chicken dish I've ever had.  The difference in quality from Brandy Ho to House of Nanking was remarkable.  

I guess they dont really care anymore at House of Nanking.  Too bad.
author: Scott K.

description: This place is always good and fairly priced. We had the braised green beans which I always get when I'm here. We also had the Sesame Chicken which was so crispy, tender and tasty, I could have eaten a bucket.
author: Luz J.

description:
This is VERY overrated. The food is seasoned well, but not impressive. I ordered the scallops and they chopped the 2 scallops into little pieces, and charged $14.  

Everyone in my group was disappointed and regretted the decision to eat here. It is 99% full of white hipsters eating here, for a restaurant in SF Chinatown, that is a very bad sign.

There are dozens of better restaurants in the neighborhood, this is not worth your money.
author: Lucca B.

description:
WARNING: HORRIBLE FOOD AND BAD SERVICE!  Read the most recent reviews, and you can judge for yourself...

Based on the 3.5 stars from a quick Yelp search and the long line in front of the restaurant (about 20 people), we decided to give House of Nanking a try...especially after the waitress kept telling us that the wait was no longer than 20 minutes.  She either lied or can't estimate time well because we ended up waiting for over 40 minutes.

This wouldn't have been a huge problem except for the LOUD, intoxicated homeless guy who kept approaching everybody in line and getting close enough to practically kiss them!  The crazy thing is the restaurant manager and waiters saw the guy soliciting everybody, but did nothing to ensure the safety of their customers in line.  Luckily, my friend is a big guy and would have taken him out with one blow.

So after finally getting into the restaurant, I noticed that a waitress was wiping down the table with a dirty towel.  The table was soaking wet, and my friend ended up wiping the table off with a napkin.  Three waitresses just watched as he dried the table!  Overall, the restaurant was dirty and a health hazard in many respects.

The worst part of the experience was definitely the food.  FYI, we ordered three dishes and paid over $43, which included paying for steamed rice.  YES, they charge for "Uncle Ben's tasting" steamed rice.  

So here's the breakdown of why the food was so bad:

Sesame chicken = right before the dish was served, we saw the cashier (who had been handling money and credit cards) pick up a handful of sesame seeds and tossed it over ours and another customer's chicken dish.  Gross!  The other issue with the dish is that the thinly sliced sweet potatoes were not cooked all the way through, and they were bland.  The actual chicken was okay, but nothing spectacular.

Salt and Pepper Shrimp with Mushrooms = The entire dish was deep fried and bland.  The shrimps were deep fried in a tempura batter, but it needed both salt and pepper.  The mushrooms were soaking in a puddle of oil.  This dish should be called Bland Shrimp with Oily Mushrooms.

Last but not least was the crispy noodle dish with beef.  This was the most disgusting dish that I have ever eaten from a Chinese restaurant.  There were three of us in the party, and none of us could eat more than a few bites.  The "crispy" noodles were basically placed on a plate, and the sauce which consisted mostly of vinegar was poured over it.  There was way too much vinegar for that dish.  We couldn't tell what else was on the dish.  I think I recognized remnants of beef somewhere in the dish.

4 words on the customer service: "IT SUCKED BIG TIME!"

So the good news is that I'm happy to write this review for my fellow Yelpers to help them make an informed decision.  The bad news is we all have heartburn, and we're on vacation!  Ugh!
author: Grace L.

description: This place is so accommodating for wheat and peanut allergies! They are a peanut-free facility, and use gluten free soy sauce. Wonderful, friendly service, and delicious variety of food! Great for groups, but the wait can get long -- because it's overall so good!
author: Alyssa W.

description:
My huz introduced me to this restaurant he said i will love the food here knowing me he knows that i m not really into chinese food so i didnt expect too much, we stepped in and saw lots of people enjoying their food and i noticed this restaurant bring in different customers (not just asians love them). 

We ordered Calamari, Chicken Sesame with sweet potato and the one the was not in the menu but very popular Shrimp and Apple! Wow it was all delish! I told my huz it's not typical chinese more like fusion Chinese which i appreciate more. We will definitely come back again!
author: Em S.

description: I haven't been here since 2010, so this review is way overdue. To be honest, I don't remember what we ordered because we pretty much let the wait staff pick all the dishes, anything that was super good and enough for 10 people. We had numerous dishes, all of which were super delicious and left me in a food coma. So when you come here, just tell them to order you the best menu items and trust that your tummy will thank you later. Service was...well, you know how service at Chinese establishments are, so keep your expectations low in that department.  Not sure how much the menu has changed in 6 years, but I loved this place. I walked by here recently, and there was a line out the door, so my assumption is that it's still living up to the recommendations. If I wasn't already full from my brunch, I would have hit this place up for old time's sake.
author: Diane V.

description: Call it sentimental, but this has long been my favorite San Francisco Chinese restaurant. I understand that some people fault the place because it isn't authentic-- but on the other hand I've been to China and have a mental aversion to dishes with unrecognizable animal parts. Bottom line, the food here is consistently delicious, even if it is modified to meet Customer tastes. I first came here years ago, before the most recent renovation, when there was a counter, and Francis Ford Coppola was having lunch. I figured I made a good choice. Since then, every visit to San Francisco includes at least one meal here. I've never been disappointed. What I especially appreciate is that your server will let you know when you over order. If you come for lunch, get here early, there is always a line.
author: Norman S.

description:
Kathy, I'm not even sure where to start but here goes...your restaurant is filthy.  The health inspector could spend hours upon hours writing this place up for violations.  What violations you ask?? How about our server giving us 4 waters from the same area that the dishes were being washed or maybe his dirty hands that were all over the rims of the glasses when he set them on our dirty, sticky table?  Maybe it would be another server eating a hard boiled egg at a table in the main seating area and then spitting out the parts she didn't want and then drying bowls with a towel that she had on her lap??  Should I mention the dirty plates that were at our table??  

The sizzling rice soup that wasn't sizzling but actually looked like it was left over from another party?  The garlic beef we ordered that never showed up until we had completely finished our horrible meal?  The rude server???  Kathy, I could go on and on but it's not worth my time.  Your restaurant has probably lost sight of why it opened in the first place.  It's clear to me it's all about revenue and tourism thus the poor quality food, horrible service, and extremely dirty restaurant.  As I said in my first post, I will never return but rest assured I'll tell many of our experience.
author: RJ P.

description:
Et tu, House of Nanking? 

My friends and I used to cross the city at the drop of a hat to experience the divey euphoria of House of Nanking. In the go-go 90s they used to stay open much later. It could be 10 at night and we would look at each other and say, "shrimp cakes!" and that would be it. HoN has always been inexpensive, but they never used to be cheap. Now they are both, and I'm sad to see the loss of a great North Beach institution.

To be fair, House of Nanking probably jumped the shark several years ago. I haven't frequented the place much during the last 10 years so I can only imagine they have degraded by degrees--or perhaps their quality dropped suddenly when a certain standard-maintaining chef died or retired. That certain chef is sorely missed.

I have uploaded a photo of their current version of shrimp cakes, and you really have to be familiar with the music of Neil Young to fully grapple with such a stunning drop in care and vision. They used to be round, carefully pinched and textured pucks stuffed with shrimp, onions, peas, shallots, and other vegetables, and topped with a delicately spicy ginger peanut sauce and sprinkled with minced scallions. Truly divine. And now, like Neil, just tired sadness.

I won't linger on in the abstract: this is about the Nanking that was, and is; not about me! Suffice it to say that the food now cannot be distinguished from many of the other nearby quick and greasy Chinese purveyors, and survives only on the power of legend. In time, that too shall pass. A single tear rolls down my cheek.

Goodbye, House of Nanking.
author: Gary P.

description: Nice dishes. Heard about this place for a long time. Here I come and I can see why so many people choose here.
author: Shuo Y.

description: Asked for Chinese hidden menu when I got into the restaurant at busy hour. Impressive soup noodle in pork broth. A good place to go for Chinese food! However, due to the busy hour the service was a little slow. Seated and waited for 10mins before any waiters asked me what did I want to order.
author: Yuzhou C.

description: Cold rainy days = this place. Yummy eggplant, house special sesame chicken, house fried rice and cool tea selection . This place is fast fresh and tasty!
author: Cecilia D.

description:
You know that awkward moment when you get caught staring at the dishes on the table next to you ? Haha the French girl recommended the wonton soup and the "famous" sesame chicken. We decided to give it a try

Dishes:

Sesame chicken ($9.95): sweet sauce, crispy. The sweet potato was delicious. 

Garlic fish(~$10) : fresh fish, didn't taste the garlic much but it was good. 

Wonton soup : I wasn't a fan of the wontons, but the basil based broth and crispy rice won me over. 

Service: the owners were nice and attentive. 

Ambiance: this looks like the hidden restaurants I found in China. Very dark inside; wooden tables and chairs, boxes of cans and bottles in the floor.

Overall it's a good place. They have a different take on Chinese food, prices are reasonable, although compare to Chinatown it's a bit pricey. 

*they give out souvenir chopsticks if you ask
author: Mily W.

description: So sad, another SF great is dead. This place used to be the sh!t, where you could show off to visiting friends, a cool underground SF eatery. Now its dirty, dusty, staff is rude & food is so poor quality its embarrassing to take friends anymore. Not only are menu's a mess of scribbling prices out, they charge what they want! So bad
author: trisha f.

description:
House of Nanking!!!  Best Chinese food in SF!!!! My co-workers brought me here on one of our business trips back in 2008.   Since, I've never missed a chance of eating here every time I visited SF :)))

It's a small restaurant located in the financial district area (down the street from the Hilton SF). You can spot the colorful sign and the red carpet entrance walking down Kearny street!  Not too sure about lunch time, but there's almost ALWAYS a line out front during dinner time!! :/ the restaurant itself is quite small with very simple decoration.  The service is a bit unpleasant but the foods are super AMAZING..so it kinda makes up for it!! (But then again, I'll ALWAYS make exception for Nanking ;). ). Every dish they serve is legit!! To name some, below are a few of my favorite dishes:

-blossom tea: soo good and beautiful
-chicken w/ green bean
-calamari
-eggplant in garlic sauce
-house fried rice
-Crispy honey beef

Will see you again Nanking!! ;)
author: TeeTee V.

description:
This restaurant is owned by the same owner as Fang. I enjoyed Fang so much because the owner ordered off the menu items for me, so I decided to try this one out. 

The seating is very traditional ancient style. The menu is very creative. You cannot find these dishes anywhere else. No broccoli beef please. It's Nanking food. The dishes sound like Cantonese food but it's not. Very different and innovative. They have one menu for Chinese in Chinese and one for American in English. 

Fish soup with thin noodle, tofu and wonton. Not Cantonese one! It's so good! A bit sour and pickled veggie makes it flavorful but not bland. The fish is fried very good. Soup is awesome. $14.95. 

The eggplant with minced pork and shrimp paste. Also very good. The shrimp paste flavor makes it unique! I've never seen this combination before in any Chinese place. But I still think eggplants are too oily like other normal Chinese restaurants. 

They grew organic goji in shanxi. Their tea uses that goji, $2. The taste of goji is different than other non organic ones. Less sweet and fresher.
author: Ashley C.

description:
Yelpers you have failed me!!  I read the reviews and was so excited about this place until the second we sat down. I took all the recommendations from other reviews but was still so let down with the entire experience. 

There was a small wait when we arrived about 10 minutes and when we were finally taken through the tiny restaurant the person leading us just signaled us where to go because we couldn't hear her over the noise. I was starving and ready for a fabulous meal but the people who worked here just seemed to want to feed everyone and get them out as soon as possible. 

First let's start with the ambience. We came on a Sunday night and it was dark, very crowded ( no space between you and other tables) and VERY loud.  The place is dark and messy and they store all there stuff all over the place. I'm surprised this place has passed a health inspection. The chairs are so uncomfortable but that is the smallest of my complaints. We got menus (which look like they are the originals from the 80s) with pen marks crossing out the old prices and hand written new prices (so unprofessional). Also the plates we were given were different. Mine was white and my husbands was a blue bowl. All of these things would have been excusable had the food been good. 

We were then greeted by a rude woman who asked "what do you want!?" We ordered sesame chicken, house noodles, and shrimp packets. She then grabbed the menus from the table and walked away. I was going to order one more thing but I guess she thought it was enough food for two people and cut me off. 

About 2 minutes later we got the shrimp packets which were disgusting! Literally a piece of dough with frozen peas and 1 tiny shrimp inside doused in peanut sauce. Gross. I then asked for a knife and the guy said "you want a knife?! Ha!" as if it was such a ridiculous question (he ended up brining two knives and just dropped them into the table).

A few minutes later came our house noodles which are similar to Top Ramen. They were ok but nothing special. Then about 10 minutes passed and we got the sesame chicken which was over breaded, over friend, and drenched in sauce. I asked for some water but the lady just shot me a look (never got the water). 

We then asked for the check because we were getting sick from the abundance of sauce and oil we just ate. No one asked how our meal was or if we wanted anything else. We then walked around Chinatown and would look into every nice restaurant and were so upset that we chose Nanking. 

Do not go here! Servers are rude and food is nasty! Save your money for Panda Express!
author: Karin M.

description:
soooo i've always been really curious about this place since i walk by it all the time on kearny, and it's ALWAYS so packed..! and the sign outside is quite colorful... a friend from seattle actually recommended that i try it since he comes here every time when on business in sf, so i decided to give it a go for my birthday dinner with the parents. kinnndda risky, given, that parents eat chinese food a lot...in china...

we walk in, and everything smells delicious, and every table has a ton of good looking food that people seem to enjoy eating. we got a table right away, which is awesome, and were given the 'chinese' menu, which is handwritten.  the lady of the house spoke to us in shanghainese after hearing the three of us converse, and offered to make recommendations, which we gladly took.

given that it was a cold evening, we got the fish soup with noodles and basil...maybe with a hint of lemongrass? we also got birthday noodles with peanut sauce, and sauteed vegetables (dou miao), which is a staple that i compare restaurants against. also got the house special beef, which is a unique dish that my dad seemed to enjoy a lot. 

soooo, everything was gooood, but not great, and i really wanted it to be great. sigh. the soup was probably my favorite. the noodles and veggies were both a bit bland; the beef is interesting yes, but the bok choy tasted kinda raw, and were cold - not very characteristically chinese.

with that said, the servers were alll so courteous, and the dishes came out WAY fast, which i think is a plus. the restaurant itself is a bit loud, but that can be expected with a chinese place.  the lady who recommended dishes also suggested Fang, which is owned by the same person. mmmm, maybe i will give it a try one day, since i live in soma and fang is pretty conveniently close... :)
author: Christina L.

description: By far the best Chinese food I've ever had! The sesame chicken is simply amazing... Huge portion sizes for the price!
author: Bryce B.

description:
Much, much OVERated. This place gets rave reviews from diners here on yelp and everywhere else. Why? Have eaten there three times and each time I tried to find what is it that makes people give House Of Nanking five stars. Failed to find why.

My third time there was similar to the first two. The food I ordered, different dishes for the two of us each time there, was average or below average, for being tasty. The prices were high. What we ordered would be ten dollars less in most other Chinatown restaurants. 

I had the house fried rice, which had traces of meat in it and she had the Mongolian steak. We both thought that the food tasted below average. 

The next day, we ate at House Of Xian Dumpling, which is next door and loved our meal. It was also about ten dollars cheaper. Pleas read my review of them. 

I recommend that you walk past the House Of Nanking and have a tasty meal at House Of Xian Dumpling- 925 Kearny.
author: Steven G.

description: Definitely a different take of most Chinese dishes I have had. The green onion pancake in particular. It wasn't bad at all, just different. I also had the dry fried beef and bok choy which was pretty tasty and unique as well.
author: Nikk G.

description:
I couldn't bring myself to give them a higher rating than 2 stars.  The unauthentic Chinese cuisine and poor service leads me to believe that this establishment is nothing more than a tourist trap.

Service: 1 star - the old man, most likely the manager or the owner, was extremely rude and rushed us to order.  He came back multiple times within a span of a few minutes and didn't give us a chance to peruse the menu. When we were ready to order, he grunted all the way through and didn't even make eye contact.

----What we got----
Hot Tea: WHAT KIND OF ASIAN RESTAURANT CHARGES $3.50 FOR TEA? The tea came in a mug, real authentic...

Shrimp Packets - Fried wonton wrappers with shrimp inside: definitely didn't live up to the hype and the ratio of wrapper to meat was off

Steam pork and veggie dumplings with spicy soy sauce: pretty good, I liked the spicy soy sauce

Sesame Chicken - w/ sweet potato and garnished w cucumber salad: unique dish, nothing memerable

"Melt in your mouth" Fried Calamari: this was disgusting! It was soggy and oily.. If I could give this negative stars, I would! Melt in your mouth? Joke was on us, the oil and batter was melting all over our mouths.  My stomach is churning just thinking about how oily these things were. Blech!

Pork Chop - bone in: I didn't like how they gave us a huge pork chop with no knife and expected us to eat it with chopsticks.  Since this is family style, it should've been chopped up

Lettuce Cups with Shrimp - battered and lightly fried shrimp with mixed veggies: I've never had lettuce cups with fried shrimp and mixed veggies, but I don't think I'm a fan of it.  My speculation is that they took a popular dish (fried shrimp and mixed veggies) and made it into a lettuce cup dish by adding lettuce.

My takeaway is that this place caters towards American tourists and if you don't look like a tourist, you won't be treated with respect.  If the food was good, I'd overlook the poor service, but since we were treated rudely, charged $3.50 a person for tea, and the food was extremely unauthentic, I wouldn't come back.
author: Michelle W.

description: Rice popping on a wonton soup was really great on rainy days. However it isn't spicy enough even if I had added 3 spoonful of chili paste. Great savory taste with a fresh hint of lemon in the broth. Be careful if your throat is sensitive to oily food.
author: Christina O.

description: Definitely by far the best Chinese food I have eaten. Every thing we ordered, from salt and pepper shrimp to sesame chicken were mouth watering flavors dancing in your mouth awesomeness. Service was fast and terrific. Will I ever come back? Heck yea!!
author: Bennett H.

description: Onion pancake that's what's up!!! Nice crispy but also was a sweet and sour sauce. General Tso's chicken was bite sized cut and cover in a sauce. Dishes are all family style good place to bring two or three people
author: Patterson N.

description:
Bad service but good food.
I asked for Broccoli and beef (off the menu) and they totally accommodated my order.

We had a chicken lettuce wrap, calamari melt in your mouth steaks and ice cream. Everything was delicious and perfectly well made.
author: Prusha S.

description: Great food , fast service . Know what you want cause the waiters want to know quick lol . The sizzling rice soup was so yummy with a little crispy rice in every bite . Their hot tea comes in a beer mug and has a really refreshing flavor, very hot , it takes a bit to cool down . We got a spicy shrimp that was really spicy but good . Definitely try it if your visiting the Bay Area !
author: Lisa M.

description: We got our food SECONDS after ordering it. We destroyed the sesame chicken, house noodles with chicken added, and the crispy noodle tower with fish. And nothing was salty, but it was SO flavorful. Definitely a return spot.
author: Trakela W.

description:
Its the most delicious chinese food I have ever enjoyed over and over....
Wish they had a cook book..:))
author: Ingrid M.

description:
As a vegetarian I found the options to be awesome. I ordered a blackbean tofu dish that was a lot better than any Chinese food we have at home. My boyfriend got sesame chicken that he also loved. Huge portions as well! If you're in a hotel without a mini-fridge you'll be bummed to leave the remainders behind.

Seating is tight and I would think that if it's busy, some people might be a little uncomfortable. It kind of added to the vibe of the place though, in my opinion. Like a mind-blowing-Chinese-food-cafeteria.

The service is lacking. But we weren't in a hurry and didn't really care, because the food was sooooo good. 

Basically, if you want bomb, affordable (for San Francisco standards) Chinese food that you won't possibly be able to finish, this is for you.
author: Amy R.

description: MSG overload with the wonton soup (tiny portion) and fried black bean eggplant - though both were pretty yummy. Additionally when the tall waitress first served me - she dropped the soup on the other side of the table. For five minutes I thought she was going to sit across from me until another waiter explained - that was MY order. She served the eggplant on the other side of the table too, but at least by then I understood the drill - LOL. I do love family-like bantering between the staff (they even play Ro Sham Bo to see who's going to bus the table) and the owner is really nice. Also, has the SF Health Inspector failed to notice all the food storage directly on the floor . . . shame! You catch my drift?
author: Leslie L.

description:
The best chinese restaurant . taste , menu , tea , everything is beautiful. 

Especially their tea and shrimpackets ( if i wrote it correct ) 
Service is fast enough. For me , the best chinese food ! 
A+ ! 

But , staff are very rude ! Almost all of them ! They really have to think about it.
author: Jay M.

description: The food was terrible. Had the hit and sour soup. So much vinegar. The tofu soup SME thing. The sesame chicken with sweet potatoes. Terrible.  I did give top and the guy said get out. Not coming here again.
author: John M.

description:
Tell them you are hungry, hand back the menus, and let the awesome begin.

We have been here twice and will be back again. Food was fast and great!
author: Beau M.

description:
I could quite literally kiss the cook! My picky 2 year old daughter killed part of my meal of black bean tofu and broccoli. In fact, she ate whatever we put in front of her. 

This was one of the first meals where she not only ate all of her food, but she was well-behaved during the entire meal. I fully see the merits of communal seating and no high chairs. It seems freedom kept her reigned in and my husband and I actually had a conversation over dinner. 

You guys get five-plus stars! I haven't had that pleasant of a sit down meal in a long time! We'll definitely be back.

PS-my food was really delicious!
author: Erika B.

description:
special American Chinese food near Chinatown.

interior is nice, decorated in Chinese theme.

nothing is wrong with the food if you look at it in an American Chinese food standpoint. Overly oily, deep fried, and overly sweeten.

personally I like Traditional Chinese food, this is why I had to rate this based on my preference.

service is good, place can be very noisy.
author: Zack Y.

description: I love this place... It is a must every time I visit San Fran.
author: Sergio G.

description:
Oh San Francisco... You're so lucky! Up in Seattle we don't have quite the awesome options you do when it comes to Chinese eateries. 

When I was in town recently for a work trip, my coworker suggested a group of us dine here at House of Nanking. With only one hour and a small(ish) budget for our group, we stopped in here and found everything we needed. 

We shared 5 dishes across the 4 of us, each priced anywhere form $6-$12 a plate. Since it was a cold day I also asked for some tea. Little did I know it'd be this amazing tightly bundled tea that literally blossomed in my glass! It was so impressive - and tasty - that two other coworkers ordered it as well. Then we sat in silence, just watching and waiting for the tea to blossom.

There were chicken dishes, veggie dishes, and all types of plates to order and share among friends. Whether you order your own dish to keep for yourself, or you share among the group, this place is great for just about anyone.
author: Katy H.

description: As long as you're fine eating at a table that's squished next to someone else's, you'll enjoy House of Nanking. It has fast service, great food, and a very concise menu compared to most Chinese restaurants! I split the Five Spice Pork Chops and the Sesame Chicken with 2 sides of rice. Between the two I preferred the Sesame Chicken, especially because it came with a side of thinly sliced sweet potato which were AMAZING.
author: Carolina S.

description:
Underwhelmed. Sesame chicken not that good. Even the rice was dry and terrible.  Tourist trap. 

This is why I give it a low rating;  You know that after taste in your mouth of old unchanged frying oil that just won't go away?   Yeah, I have that. I just shoved 4 chocolate chip cookies in my mouth to make it go away, brushed my teeth and had some mouth wash. 
I'm over the  Chinese food in Chinatown. I always question sanitation and the quality. It's just that it's close to my neighborhood. 

I always have the best Chinese and Asian food in the Inner Richmond and Outer Richmond area. Always cleaner more authentic and they genuinely just cook way better.
author: Margs B.

description:
House of Nanking is a great place for taking guests visiting San Francisco for an authentic SF experience and excellent food. Don't be upset by the service, as it is not great, but go in knowing that and just enjoy the food and the people you are with. 

Order anything that has the pea shoots- the salad or cooked are absolutely delish and a must.
author: Kara W.

description:
DO NOT DRINK THE WATER. I was waiting in line to use their single bathroom when one of the servers came and used a dirty old sink next to the bathroom that looked like it was for rags and filled up a cup of water, put a straw in it, and served it to a customer!!

Thats just one example of an entire experience of rudeness, callousness, and downright disrespectful customer service we received at this restaurant. I can literally give you a list of negative moments from my one visit.
- we had to call our waiter twice just to get our drink order in, he left as soon as he took the order and never came back
- Chow mein was burned to a crisp
- A lady came by asked me if I was ready to order, snatched my menu, and gave it to another table and left!
- they brought out our orders one plate at a time in 10 minute intervals, just enough time to have everyone's food be cold :)
- mid meal my friend asked a lady for a sprite since we noticed where they got their water from, it never came
- lots of other things, like no hellos, how are you, basically what you would expect from a busy McDonald's on their worst day

What forever became an inside joke to me and my friends was that at the end of this root canal experience was when we went up to pay a lady snatched our receipt and tried to charge us 20 dollars more than what it said. She said that was the tip she had earned and refused to accept anything less. My friend just kind of stood there for a minute before my wife jumped in and said she couldn't legally charge us whatever tip she wanted, especially given that she didn't even service our table. Another server came up and said well people usually tip 10% so you can tip that instead, that's when I jumped in and said alright so it is up to us to determine what we tip,  we then paid for our meal and left! Unbelievable that these people think they can bully customers into tipping for absolute god awful service!!
author: Michael S.

description: I've been here one time before and the food was good. I came here with my family yesterday and the service was TERRIBLE. Lady demands for a tip even though she ignored us multiple times for forks and an extra plate.. Super awkward especially chasing us down for it. It was obvious that they didn't like serving a table of 4. And demanding a higher tip? Are you serious?
author: Melayah F.

description:
I'm unsure if I should write an ok review or a bad one.  Well, I felt ripped off by the owner / old guy.  He comes up to our table, talks to the people looking Chinese asking if we speak Mandarin.  One of us says he does and I say I don't but I understand some Cantonese.  He then asks us what village we were from.  He seemed to recognized my ancestor's village.  Next, he asks if any of us have been to House of Nanking before which none of us have.  So, he recommends he orders for us since he can relate to our ancestral village.  After scribbling something in chinese in his notepad, he hands it to the cook and he moves onto the next table.

About 10-20 minutes later, we receive about 5 different dishes none of which I know what they are.  One is a veggie dish which I think is bok choy with garlic.  Next is something that resembles a Taiwanese oyster pancake with brown sauce on top.  Then there's a fish soup dish.  There's also a tofu dish with greens for our vegetarian friend.  Finally, there's a 5th unknown dish which I still don't know what it is.  The food was pretty good.  I expect something cheap since the place looks somewhat of a dirty chinese restaurant hole-in-the-wall style and they have minimum wage immigrants.  What I didn't expect was a $90 bill for the 5 dishes.  That's about $18 a dish!  I expect maybe $10-12 tops but that's being generous.  It's definitely not organic and not free range chickens.
author: Ronald L.

description:
A friend recommended House of
Nanking in China Town and we decided to give it a try. The wait was not bad for a Friday afternoon, 15 min. We decided to order Sesame Chicken, Fried Calamari. I asked Mr. Fang to bring us something spicy and he brought us spicy/crispy beef which was amazing. This
place is simply the best in town!
author: Frankie2 K.

description: The ice tea, detoxifying ice tea, was fabulous!! And the food was really tasty. Give it a try yo
author: Ziad A.

description: So yummy! I'm vegetarian so I got the eggplant and sweet potato dish with chow mien. I loved them both! My partner got the Nanking Chicken and he loved. It's family style, so we shared the chow mien and then each got our own dish. We had plenty left over. The service is great too! We were welcomed in and got sat right away. We ordered our food and we're served rather quickly as well. We're definitely goi
author: Amanda P.

description:
Was looking for some Chinese food near china town and several people from work recommended.  I am glad they did.  While it looks like a whole in the wall restaurant the food and service itself was so much better.  I sat down and ordered and within 5 minutes had my food.  I had the pot stickers which were the best pot stickers I have ever had.  Highly recommend that anyone that comes here gets them.

For my meal I had the sesame chicken, which while tasted great was kinda of chewy.  Definitely had better sesame chicken elsewhere, it was still fine.  Overall I ate the pot stickers, sesame chicken with steamed rice, and two Chinese beers and only spent $25.  

The staff was very attentive and friendly with great service.  Place isn't huge but will accommodate as when I was leaving a very large college group came in and where seated at a big table.
author: Russell D.

description: This has to be the best Chinese food I have ever eaten!  Everything we ordered was fresh and bursting with flavor.  We had the sesame chicken, stuffed mushrooms, and the cold sesame noodles.  The service was lightening quick and super friendly!  Even though this is a fast-paced dining experience, we did not feel rushed. I highly recommend this place!
author: Mayra E.

description:
It depends on what you order. From my experience, I wouldn't return.
Double cooked pork with green beans is pretty flavorful . I recommend it.
Steamed pork dumplings taste like they are from frozen cheap packages. The sauce was too basic.
Fish with Sichuan pickle was kinda horrible. No taste of the Sichuan pickle and fish was not fresh. I don't see any other spices in the dish at all. 
Rice was.. like leftover, cooked with too much water kind of rice. 
Blossom tea was nice, you can see the flower coming out from a tea ball. However, mine didn't bloom!
I probably gave too much expectation to this place as it's very touristy and always busy. 
If you are really hungry and happen to be around this place will do. But don't go to this place to impress your Chinese friend.
author: Shanshan Z.

description: It is an awesome place, I really surprised the food. The dishes could be called creative Chinese food (combine with western). The target is for young. Even it not kind of transitional Chinese cuisine, the taste keeps chief's talent. But unfortunately here always has so many people while the dinner time or holiday. If no reservation, just need wait. And the space for each table is not big, sometime I would touch the arm of others who is next to me.
author: Hung Ying L.

description: Poor example of Chinese food available here in SF. We tried Sweet Chicken with Sesame and Chicken Fried Rice, Pork Egg Rolls and Pot Stickers. The Pork Egg Rolls were over fried but where the only item we thought passable. Not recommended at all.
author: Greg M.

description: This is the best Chinese food I've had since my last trip to Beijing. The intimate spot blew me away. The service was fast and courteous, especially when the owner came over to check on us. We told him we were from the east coast and he sent over some cute chop sticks as souvenirs.
author: A J.

description: I Loved the food here ! The customer service is awful !! Super rude waiters ! But the food tasted so good it was almost worth it .! Lol
author: Ana K.

description:
Call this place whatever you want, tourist trap, crowded, trendy, dive, greasy spoon, not lunch friendly or single person friendly - but it has some of the best damn Chinese food in town if not maybe the whole country. 

I recommend letting the owner/chef choose your food, he will bring out the best and freshest entrees of the day.
author: Kyle D.

description:
I was so eager to try Nanking and finally went yesterday. My boyfriend and I came for dinner, seated in a 6 seater table together with a family of four. We didnt mind, especially with the line outside! 

We had two dishes, the waiter who said he was the "chef" chose a dish he recommended and we also had the crispy honey beef. I looooved the beef but didnt like the dish he recommended. 
I think i'll come back and choose my own dishes.
author: Anya W.

description: I generally do not write reviews, unless I strongly feel about a place and House of Nanking managed to gross me out on many levels. The tables, the waiting staff, the food, the ambiance- everything that makes up a restaurant is out of taste here. The place is so tiny that you cant turn your head without caution. The waiting staff surely dint know what customer service is and surely dint care to serve water until I choked on my food. This place repels the whole idea of going to a chinese place for me. To our surprise they charged us 30$ as gratuity for a bill of 80$ without our consent and when we asked about it, they just scribbled on the bill as tip themselves. I would recommend this place only if you want to experience bad customer service and a possible food poisoning.
author: Suman K.

description: Service was good, was able to be seated right away but this place gets packed compared to others next door. The food was okay, pretty good, but it was pretty pricey. For the price you could get more at competing places.
author: Manuel J.

description: Probably my favorite restaurant... ever. This is our go to spot whenever my husband and I vacation in SF. Our favorites include the scallop tower, sesame chicken, crispy beef, and chow mein. I highly recommend this restaurant!!
author: Jessica S.

description:
Went here for lunch to celebrate our friends bday. Had the braised fish with spicy soy, famous sesame chicken, and dumplings. All three dishes were great!!! We even had goji berry tea which was a new experience. I usually put this to make soup but never tea!!!!
Had an awesome experience and the service was great! This place is just an icon place in Chinatown. Gray for financial workers and class for the not so traditional Chinese food.
author: Valerie A.

description: This place is over hyped! The service was mediocre and the food was average, and overpriced in my opinion. We were told the dishes were large enough to share, which was not the case. We later came across "Sam Wo Restaurant" which is now our go to place when we are in SF.
author: Hector D.

description: Always the main restaurant I need to stop at when visiting San Fran. It was just as delicious and unfriendly as I remembered. While you are squished next to strangers, that is part of this eating experience. The hot and sour soup is DELISH. They didn't have the flowering bomb tea so I tried the goji berry tea which was super tasty. The house noodles were good (not as flavorful as the last time) but very light you could  easily eat the whole plate. The sesame chicken was so good!!!
author: Jenna G.

description: Never come back even the foods for free. The owner and the staffs so rude. The foods going down hill. Greedy greedy people
author: Trung N.

description:
Cramp seating  very cramped - forced to share  tables
Waiters make Mc Donald look good
cheap food at cheap prices might explain the line at door

smoother traditional Chinese with peanut sauce

atmosphere is terrible and matches the food

Have dined & cooked  Chinese all over the world....this is my worst  rating

amen
author: Patrick B.

description:
Hello Kathy,
Know this, I'm not into bashing of any kind. It was really difficult to write the review however when I got to my hotel room and opened up the packaging I was so disappointed. My life is very busy as traveling across the globe is part of it. I've had to eat all kinds of foods, good and bad. Most times I'm not picky and pretty much can work with any food, especially if there's ketchup or hot sauce around.  Unfortunately the food I had that evening from your establishment wasn't repairable. Because I'd spent the day walking I was too fatigued to come back, otherwise I would have given ya'll a chance to make it right. Alas, I was visiting and may not be in the area for a time again. I'd read several reviews and the reason I choose the sesame chicken was because it IS your signature dish. After writing this updated review I went and read other recent reviews. They all had the same experience. FOOD AND SERVICE SUCKS. I'm not sure why you are writing to make it right because you should've gotten it right the first time. You and your shop get no sympathy from me and I'll be sure to tell everyone of my traveling buddies to stay far far away from your establishment. Maybe after business is hurting enough you'll do the right thing. Too bad we have to suffer in the meantime. Geesh!
author: Silk W.

description:
Seriously???
Come on, dont be fool by their 2000+ reviews with 3.5 stars. Now i'm starting to doubt the yelpers.

Hands down to the worse chinese restaurant (food and service) in San Fran!

Ok. First of all. It's chinese restaurant. I normally dont mind about bad service. They didnt even wipe our table, i understand they're busy BUT this one lady was standing and busy with her phone watching you tube. Unbelievable. Rest of them also seriously rude, not even bother to look at us or ask for anything except for food order. The lady even looked mad when i asked for drink refill and gave me a bitter concentrated tea. Oh my god.

The food? We only got the nanking chicken which was too sweet and there was nothing special. I would buy safeway chicken over this. Seriously. And they have the weird looking wonton soup too. Try it. 
The calamari? 'Melt in your mouth' overrated. So sour like, really? Are they hating me or why am i getting bad food. Ekk.

At the end. This is the most interesting part. One of the waitress was asking us 'it should be 15%' we're like whaat?? she's talking about the tips and asked 3times. My friend was like, why are we forcing to tip? She grabed the paper walked away and said 'okay!!' Wow. Thanks for the service.
author: Wei Y.

description:
Let me start by saying this place is awesome!

Been here two weeks in a row and both meals were fantastic. 

Fish soup, potstickers, calamari, and pork belly rounded out the first meal. Fish soup has great broth, wontons, and plenty of other good items. The potstickers (crispy) have a great peanut sauce with bold flavor. The calamari had good crisp and was nice and tender. Pork belly off the chart - be in the mood for fat because the pork is nicely layered - the sauce is excellent. Paired with flowering tea - tasty and quite entertaining to watch. 

Second meal we went for a few different items. We switched up the soup for sizzling rice soup - similar broth but brand new flavor with lemon, peas, chicken, and of course, rice. Potstickers were a definite reorder and gobbled because you could count to 10. Sesame chicken, shrimp with mushrooms, and sautéed vegetables (pea shoots and spinach with garlic and onion I think) rounded out the meal. Sesame chicken is popular and has great flavor! Also includes sweet potatoes. The shrimp was nice and crispy and mushrooms carried great flavor and were cooked perfectly. Vegetables were nice and light with delicious garlic flavor (who doesn't love garlic!?).  Paired with fruit tea - light and, you guessed it, fruity - but not overpowering. Had citrus zest and various other natural flavors. 

Service here is quick. Place is always busy  - so don't be deterred by people waiting. 

Ambiance is loud, a good bustling kind of loud that you'd expect in big city life. 

People here are great. 

Recommendation? Do this!
author: Louis H.

description:
Everything is hot, fresh and delicious here. They seat and serve you promptly. 

Seating is close together, but somehow it all works out without feeling claustrophobic. 

The signature dish is Sesame chicken. The oversized fried potstickers work. Same goes for their Tom Yum Seafood soup. 

Four wontons up. Must try. A very good Chinese restaurant in China town. Worth going out of your way for.
author: Paul B.

description: Delicious food, but the servers show high pressure to get you in and out.  When you are dining you are in a bit of a fishbowl as people are in line waiting outside and looking in hungrily through the windows.  Veggies are fresh.  Flavors are good.  A classic San Francisco dining experience that you have to do at least once.
author: David S.

description:
Been to this place more than 10 years back. It was small and forgot. A cousin was visiting from Pittsburgh and wanted an authentic Chinese food.  
All 4 came out happy with the food.  The rice soup to noodles to string beans to chicken all were very good. The right level of chilliness for our spicy needs.  

The ambience is perfect to get the Chinese experience.  It's not the typical American restaurant : so we liked the packing and hustling.  They do optimize their throughput and I would expect that. 

The waiters were not rude but bordering on being just matter of fact. So we liked it. I am sure many others may not : but it's a different experience. 

Now that I re-discovered we will go back more often. We need one like that in the peninsula.
author: Renu R.

description: Overrated restaurant. Horrible customer service and absolutely average food. The restaurant has a very pissed off vibe to it. Never going there again.
author: Komal K.

description:
After a couple attempts to try this place, I finally got the opportunity!!! We arrived shortly after they opened and there was only 1 other customer in the restaurant.

Order the following:
-Nanking Chicken ($10): This is the house fave. I looked over at the other diner's tables and found that they ordered the same thing. It was good, although I would have preferred a bigger crunch (more breaded). Overall, this is their staple so it's good to order at your first visit.
-House Noodles with Beef ($11): Not bad, but not the best noodles ever. First of all, they were green and very garlicky. If you don't like garlic - you better pass. It was good for about a quarter of the dish, but I got too garlicked out. 
-Diet Coke ($2): For a can? Can't you buy a six pack for this much???
-Steamed Rice ($1.50): For a bowl that could serve 2 people. Isn't rice usually complimentary?

Service was so-so... Not the best, but I've had much worse. We weren't
acknowledged for the longest time as the 3-4 employees held their personal conversations at the back of the restaurant. 

Another SF bookmark crossed off the list...
author: Maria C.

description:
What do I know about what's good Chinese food and what's not in a city like San Francisco?  Pretty much nil.  But, I know good tasting food when I eat it and House of Nanking delivered.  What they also delivered was really fast and friendly service which made my two dining companions and I feel even better about the entire meal.

We were quickly asked for drink orders and then asked if we liked vegetables, seafood, beef, chicken.  Yes, yes, yes and yes.  She then offered to order for us and just bring some dishes to share.  Another yes and a really good call on our part.

Two appetizers appeared at our table in about 5 minutes.  The first a roasted portobello in some delicious soy based sauce, the second some yummy potstickers.  Three entrees came next - 1. Crispy Beef 2. House Chicken 3. Some shrimp and apples dish.  All three offered great flavors in a range of profiles - sweet, salty, savory, some heat...

At the end, needless to say we were three stuffed and very happy House of Nanking campers.
author: Tom C.

description:
House of Nanking was suggested as one of the best Chinese restaurants in Chinatown so it was only natural to visit.

I wasn't shocked to see a line outside of the restaurant, but I was pretty surprised that there was no walk-up list. Everyone waited in line and when a table became available for the number in your party, they called you in. While dining, I saw the hostess tell several groups of people to wait outside to be called in. There's NO waiting room inside. It's pretty small.

The food was pretty good. I didn't see the usual sweet and sour, orange chicken, etc. We decided on the fried shrimp packets with peanut sauce, and the pork egg rolls  as our appetizers,  and our entrees were fried rice, chow mein, and sesame chicken.
