The tofu in blackbean was delicious and the sauce on the scallops was absolutely amazing. Really loved the fried rice and although pretty plain the noodles tasted really nice. The fried shrimp cakes were very tasty (as was the sauce they came with). The nanking beef was reeeeeally good. We also had an eggplant dish which was tender and the flavour was delicious, but I can't remember what it was called on menu. 

The servings were huge - we ordered expecting several of them to be entree size, based on the menu (which is a little bit hard to understand), so we had enough for leftovers to enjoy again the next night.
author: Alison M.

description: great food!!! the service was very fast, but also came off kind of rude. order the blossoming tea for something warm and different, they drop a flower into boiling water and watch it bloom and add flavor. good idea to share the food kinda like tapas and order plenty of rice. if you tell the waiter what you want they will be certain to make it and surprise you even if it is not on the menu
author: Kate K.

description:
Visiting Sanfran for the 1st time and my best friend advised me I need to try this place. Hip Chinese hipster joint kind of freak me out.  This place was good.  Oh I must forewarn you whatever red wine they have there for like under 20$ a bottle is scary bad(they only have one choice.

Started with the hot and sour soup, I love that shit and eat it every other day.  This was the strangest  H/S ever, it was really thick and came as a stew but had chicken meat, tofu, peas, and egg.  After eating a couple of bites it began to grow on me, I just wish it had pork.

We got the obligatory S\sesame  chicken with sweet potatoes. It was pretty good. Not overly breaded and a flavorful sauce. Next we got the 5 spice pork chops.  They were great except they were more like 2 pork chops sliced thin into 5 razor thin chops.  Kind of disappointed but in all reality the soup could and should have been all that was needed that late at night. 

Oh yeah did I mention the wine, stay away and order beer if you are trying to keep your drunk on. Do not expect Authentic Chinese food here unless you speak the mother tongue.  Besides this is not the type of  place you go to for that order that. I did see some what I suspected were Chinese American and they were not appearing overly into the food that was being eaten.

The service was not rude just really busy, it was kind of chaotic. The food was reasonably priced for a big city and you will leave full!
author: Jeff B.

description:
This place reminds me of a Chinese restaurant you'd see on Seinfeld. No frills service, Get in, Eat, and Get Out. The friendliness levels of the staff are below par but there is still a line out the door because the food is just too damn good. 

My favorites are: Sesame chicken, crispy beef, and pea shoot salad.
author: Michelle A.

description:
Went recently. Quite disappointed. The servers are less than friendly. They dump the food on the table and walk away with barely a backward glance. No smiles, no pleasantries and apparently they have a problem with ice because they look at you funny when you ask for some in your water. 

My mother, who is allergic to dairy, refused to eat the wonton soup due to its uncharacteristic milky appearance. My dad asked the waitress what was it that gave the soup it's creamy texture. She said something in a thick Chinese accent that we just couldn't understand. She walked away in a huff. I thought maybe it was coconut milk. My dad shrugged and went back to eating his soup. However, a few minutes later our waitress magically appears at our table with a GIANT tub of powdered Coffee Mate! They put Coffee Mate in wonton soup! Who DOES that?!! 

Enough said...
author: Wendy S.

description: Unbelievable! Came in early on a Thursday for a wuick dinner before a show at the Fillmore. Sat immediately and the owner came up asked if we had been there before and we said no it was out first time,we said what is good he took the menus and said do you have any dietary restrictions? I said no meat, he brought out amazing things. So many amazing things. We couldn't handle it. I can't go into what they do with cauliflower but it's amazing.
author: Jenny J.

description: This place is pretty dirty with horrible service . While I was waiting in line to use the restroom saw one of the worker used his dirty hands to put ice in the water cups. The food came out pretty fast but wasn't that great. The wonton soup has a milky broth that had a strange taste to it. The famous house of Nanking sesame chicken was the greatest disappointment 1. It was too sweet and salty 2. The chicken was over cooked and dry 3. The sweet potato didn't really did much to compliment the chicken. All in all the place caters to tourist and white people who don't know any better. Too expensive for small tasteless dishes no thank you.
author: Betsy X.

description:
Yay! I'm definitely a fan! It is very rare for me to rank a Chinese restaurant so highly since I am Chinese and I know good, authentic Chinese food...HOWEVER this place is an exception.

I came here a few times and every single time I have had a fantastic meal.
If this place is so good, why is are there such negative reviews? Well, I figured out that there are a few reasons...however, its definitely not because of the taste of the food. I think the reason why its ranked lower is that it can get quite loud in the restaurant ( its a Chinese restaurant, what you do expect?) and service is seemingly bad but thats really just another Chinese thang (they may not say hi or bye to you, etc). The female owner seems a bit harsh and rude but thats just her being her; she means well and wants her customers to eat well.

Food wise: There are few things i LOVE. 
1.) Get the house noodles. JUST GET EM. SO GOOD. I don't know what they put in it to make it taste so good. Its a secret recipe and its a house special; just get it--no question.

2.) Sesame chicken- flavorful and not too overwhelming salty. The portion was great too.

3.) Eggplant- I LOVE IT. Get it if you want something other than meat. its really well made.

4.) Potstickers -Drenched in vinegar, soy sauce and some kind of chili. This is a great appetizer

5.) Tea dranks -filled in large beer like cups.....taste great though! 

I will be coming back here over and over and over again.
author: Eileen W.

description: As a ten year Nanjing Citizen, I can only say you are suck! Your food is not Nanjing style and your service is nothing. We do not even get water during this meal. You don't deserve even 10% tips.
author: Max X.

description:
Updating the review since they updated their Yelp listing! Not that bad after all! 

Tried some other things on the
Menu this time around and had the Onion pancakes and the Sizzling rice soup instead of the sesame chicken.
author: Vikram D.

description: Wonderful food, wonderful service, very nice and theyre willing to recommend great dishes if you're not sure what you want.
author: Diego P.

description:
Time for an update after our most recent visit. We stopped in for a late lunch on a Sunday afternoon and were pleased to be shown to a table right away. Unfortunately, that was the best part of the service experience. The food--as always--was excellent, but the surly, inefficient staff was irritating. 

We received menus right after sitting down - one-page "rice plate" menus. We had to ask twice for full menus, which were effectively thrown at us. A young Asian couple seated after us received full menus immediately. Hmmm...

With lunch ordered, we sat back and waited...and waited...and waited. Even though we didn't order family-style, that's the way we were served. As a result, one person received his order and FINISHED EATING before the last person was served. One person ordered a rice plate and was promptly served a large plate of steamed rice, only to receive the actual entree about 25 minutes later.

Adding to the unpleasant experience was the young man delivering the food. He sauntered up, dropped the plate on the end of the table and walked away without announcing the dish or attempting to learn who ordered it. 

Interestingly, a number of cases of beer were stacked in full view in the dining room. On top was a wet, used dish rag. The space next to the rag was used as a staging area for food awaiting table delivery.  

The bad attitudes and spotty service make it very difficult to recommend this place, despite its strong reputation and great food.
author: Steve L.

description: I would NEVER recommend this place. The staff is rude and unorganized. We waited for over 30 min. In a line only for them to take parties waiting behind us. The place is dirty and crammed.
author: Amber C.

description: Had to wait like 25 minutes for a table. Not too bad. The food was good to take the edge off wanting Chinese food. I would come back again. The atmosphere is different so be patient and flexible. I recommend the sesame chicken very good, and the flowering hot tea:)
author: Julie V.

description: Hidden gem that everyone wants to hit up. End of bar crawl food, get a sixer in the quickie store next door for the 20-30 min line to sit down. Locals feeling eating there and was worth it.
author: Daniel D.

description: Food was good but don't piss off the staff. We asked for a different table than the one offered and got very noticeable slower service and much smaller portions than those sitting around us.
author: Simon O.

description: The sesame chicken & fried rice were both amazing! Not the best service, but the quality of the food makes it worth it
author: Doug G.

description:
This place is horrible , they have the same taste for every dish they served. The serves is horrible and they are not help full with anything. 
When it came time to pay I wanted to leave cash and she demanded me to leave tip on my card not cash. I ask her why, she grabs my hand put it on the paper and says" no right here" 
So I got up and left .
author: Carlos M.

description:
This place is something very unique. It is a hole in a wall. The restaurant has boxes of beer and cans stacked ceiling high. It reminds me of what I would assume an authentic Chinese place would look like in China. 

We came on a Sunday for a late lunch, and had no problem with seating, even for a group of 7 people. After we sat down, we were approached by a lady, who just asked what we wanted in terms of meat, and left. We weren't sure if we just ordered or what was happening. 

Couple minutes later the waiter came and took our orders. And 10 minutes later we had our food(super fast!). I ordered the famous sesame chicken and I can say that it was amazing. The honey sauce is something magical and the sweet potatoes perfectly complemented the dish! It was by far the best Chinese food I have ever eaten. I do recommend ordering mild as the regular version is spicy by default.

You are definitely not coming here for the service! They gave my friend spicy when he ordered mild and overall we felt not like guests but more like just another customer that has to be fed. 

But once you look past the service this place has amazing food at very reasonable pricing! I will definitely be coming back!
author: Greg B.

description: Easily one of the best restaurants in SF. I usually have them pick my dishes for me. Don't go expecting to be pampered or fussed over. It's not a hold your hand, treat you nicey nicey kind of place.
author: Franklin W.

description:
When I was a kid, every now and then I ate my Chinese friend's mother's cooking. Every time I had a belly ache and then the runs. No runs at Nanking.

Giving this place the full five stars. After reading reviews of other Chinese restaurants, wondering why they average 4 stars, going to those places and being disappointed, I think back to House of Nanking.

I don't eat Chinese often, but when I do, I hope that the food tastes fresh, not greasy or fried with cheap oil. Didn't taste cheap oil at this place. Not all Chinese food is the same. This is not a dumpling house. 

It's unfortunate that so many people have not had a good experience regarding their hours. I went during lunch time and didn't have to experience those minutes when the staff wants to go home. Hey, San Francisco is not New York City where kitchens are open late. Maybe the restaurant should post closing time at 9.

Ordered the onion pancakes and calamari. Yum. Looking forward to trying something else.
author: Kiai K.

description: Different is the only way to describe it. Was going to order couple things then the owner insisted on ordering for us.  Very different from Chinese food I've had and I've had a lot. If this is ethnic Nanking food then not sure if I would look for Nanking food again. I did enjoy trying something so different. Not even sure how to describe it. If ur looking to try something new and different this is it. If ur looking for good traditional Chinese food this is not it.
author: Jacob L.

description: A local saw me searching Yelp for a good Chinese food restaurant in Chinatown.  She suggested Nanking. After checking the Yelp rating we were on our way.  Good food. Polite service.  Very fast.  Reasonable prices.  An appealing combination!
author: Greg P.

description: Wow was I truly amazed. I went into it thinking that it'll be just another typical Chinese restaurant, but boy was I wrong! This was the absolute most authentic, most delicious Chinese restaurant I have ever been to. It truly was a fantastic meal. The sesame chicken, onion cakes, and potstickers were all truly amazing. Not to mention how great the green beans were. I recommend this to ANYONE! Even if you don't like Chinese food, you are bound to love this place!
author: Eric F.

description:
Rude. Nasty. They slammed the door on us even though their hours showed open. Yo. Your food ain't that good to be treated like a peasant and have a door slammed in your face. Use your words and explain what's up. Not going back. There are so many other choices. 

Got update from them stating they were sorry we came when they were closed. NO! THEY WERE OPEN ACCORDING TO THEIR WEBSITE and YELP. They had no hours signs posted. The point is they slammed the door in our face and were nasty!  Don't try to sound like you care when if you did you wouldn't hire rude employees.
author: lisa b.

description: This place gets mixed reviews and I'm not sure why. I went with a group of 5 on a Friday night. Service was great, food was delicious. All the other patrons were Asian, which is usually a good sign when you're at an Asian restaurant. The place was busy but in a fun hustle-and-bustle type way that made the whole experience feel more authentic. We got the bao bing wrap, eggplant curry and a rice dish and all were excellent.
author: Laura B.

description:
I am sad to write this as Nanking and Fangs was my go to place for lunch or dinner with colleagues and friends. However their service has got worse from last few visits and today was the tipping point for all of us (a group of 5).
Forget good or even decent customer service the wait staff won't even smile just bang food plates on the table and go.

Today they took my colleagues plate while she still had food in her folk. Took credit card without asking. Forgot a togo order which we requested from the beginning. 
We were really unhappy with the whole experience still we tipped about 7%. The waiter takes the signed copy before even we get up, looks at it and then he gives a stare and talks to his colleague in their language. As if this wasn't enough  he comes to our table while we were getting up and says we have to tip him atleast 15% !!!  What for???
We told the guy he forgot our order. Rather than apologizing he kept arguing that he needs 15% tip.  We were so done that left without saying anything further and were like this was our last time here.

Wish the management looked into improving their customer service.
author: Pankti S.

description: Fantastic Sesame Chicken & Fish dishes. Very small and service can be "casual" at times. Even the locals say the food quality is consistent. It's worth the wait
author: Dave H.

description: Absolutely amazing. The crispy beef seems to be made for the gods. The chef came to our table took our menus and ordered for us. Wish I could have him do that every time. Again, absolutely awesome food.
author: Dan M.

description:
Service was sloppy at best and the food was meh.
We ordered Chow Mein, Bao Bing Beef Wraps, Sesame Chicken and Crab Soup.

The crab soup came with crab alright, but the crab was uncracked. We got three little leg pieces and a few joints that you couldn't get anything out of. I felt so barbaric trying to crack open my food with my fingers.

The Beef Wraps were filled with what I've come to expect Chinese delivery beef to taste like. These stringy and chewy beef pieces either had an "off night" or Mid-west Chinese delivery is actually quite fantastic and of equal taste and quality to Nanking.

The Sesame Chicken was the least impressive, according to our party of four. Most people liked the standard taste of the Chow Mein, which was actually good.

I loved my blossoming tea, it was so beautiful. But the quality of the tables (all of my food kept sliding to the right, there was such a harsh tilt to the table), the poor quality of customer service and oh. my. god. The bathroom... which was blocked by a few servers who refused to move to let the lady out of the bathroom, or to let me in. I ended up squeezing past them as they stood there staring at me, unmoving.

Now I've only seen this type of bathroom at shady 7-11 stops. The floor was soaking wet. There was so much water (hopefully) on the floor, they required a raised mat to for you to step on in front of the sink. The toilet was stained and absolutely filthy. The soap dispenser couldn't have had anti-bacterial soap in it... it felt more like a mixture of dish soap and water, with the same consistency. Gross, gross, gross. They had the lights dimmed really low in the bathroom, but even then, it was hard not to imagine myself in some horror movie. 

The only good part of this experience was the fact that we only waited 5 minutes to get in. I hear that people line up for HOURS waiting for subpar food and borderline nonexistent customer service.
author: Candice T.

description:
Literally the worse Chinese food I've bee had.....very very expensive too! We had a family of 12 so the guy said he'll just pick for us HE brought us 10 plates to share and it costed us 267 $ don't get ripped off.  


Worst food ever don't eat they rip off
author: Chris L.

description:
Given I'd been told of this place...in another state, I was truly disappointed to wait in line with a bunch of tourists (should've keyed in on that alone) to experience nothing other than an average Chinese food place. Apparently ownership changed a few years back so perhaps this is why, but needless to say we were less than pleased with the experience. 

Menu was limited (the menu on yelp is accurate and inclusive of all choices) food was mediocre at best and service was AWFUL. Staff seemed miserable and literally stood over the top of my husband while he signed the check. Frankly, I'm ok with poor aka "short" service in this type of place considering it obviously stays busy, but the lack of remote concern regarding our dining experience or even eye contact for that matter, was disturbing. Especially considering we waited patiently in line for almost an hour at and were clearly to eager to try a "local" favorite. Our enthusiasm was greeted by a staff consisting of the seemingly inconvenienced.  

Overall expect nothing at all traditional or unique. Seriously, I had to ask twice at the table for chopsticks (both ignored as staff looked straight at me and turned to walk away) so ended up going to the register to ask a third and fourth time (I'm not kidding....4 TIMES!) for them myself. Truthfully though I was so excited to finally try this place out that I didn't care. Still super pumped, WITH my hard earned chop sticks, I rushed back... to shear disappointment. 

In short, the food wasn't horrible, it just simply wasn't anything spectacular or unique for that matter either. It arrived quick after we finally ordered about 15-20mins after sitting down so it was hot and I will note, the peanut sauce on the "shrimp pockets" was tasty but nothing that I would return for. Regardless hot mediocre Chinese is better than cold so I gave an extra star for this alone.  

Main dishes were smaller than average sized and came with no rice or any other side item. This is also not a huge issue considering most portions are often too large BUT, I'd rather at least have good Chinese (X&Y or other various places in South Bay) and take leftovers, than pricey small portions of mediocre Chinese with poor service. 

Finally, In all fairness, maybe we caught it a bad time (5pm on a Sunday) but I'd do yourself a favor and either ask the locals where they eat or at least avoid waiting in line for a potentially similar deflating experience. Instead, go somewhere with a line of 'returning' customers rather than out of towners/tourists and avoid an epic yelp fail.
author: Wendy F.

description: Super quick in getting your food out to you after your order. We were seated right away, ordered and in less than 5 minutes after ordering, we were eating. The food itself is like any other Chinese Resturant, but the Green Beans dish is a must !! If you get the deep fried dumplings or the egg rolls, ask for sauce on the side. If you don't it'll come out with the sauce drizzled over it, and they will become soggy.
author: Co C.

description: The waitress just told us she would bring by plates of shrimp beef pork and chicken and we all ate family style (since we weren't sure what to order). Everything was excellent! The fried rice was also delicious.
author: Gretchen W.

description: Awesome. Great if your with friends and defiantly the food is worth the wait. If you are by yourself go past the line and ask for the one seater to the left of the door as you walk in. If you are vegetarian the spinach salad is made just right. If you are into fish get the sautéed calamari. To die for. And the beef is tastiest of all. I think the key to the place is the fresh food.
author: Chris L.

description: Amazing fried meat with bok choy. This dish wasn't even on the menu, the waitress suggested it as a house special, so it's a good idea to just ask them what's good. Great atmosphere.
author: Nicole S.

description: Best Chinese food ever. The owner took our order and then even brought out something extra for us on the house. It was AMAZING. The shrimp with the apples in cream sauce (didn't get the name) was the best thing I've possibly ever had. Fried rice tastes fresh and again the best I've had. Line is out the door during their busy times so I usually go for lunch around 1/130 since they close at 2 and is significantly less busy. Community tables and the food comes out fast and never fails to impress!
author: Kira R.

description: Food was amazing.  Sizzling rice soup... incredible.  sesame chicken, garlic beef, green beans, pork dumplings - all excellent.  Would go back in a heartbeat.
author: Joel H.

description:
This is really great Chinese but here's the caveat you need to be able to order off the Chinese menu instead of the English menu. I got lucky and was able to go with someone who spoke Chinese. 

She found this place by looking on Chinese   yelp like website and found the most recommended by Chinese people. But when we got there she felt that the English menu was very basic. Then the woman asked her if she preferred a Chinese menu which they brought out and it was much better everything on there was different. Don't worry about Chinese I'm sure they'll help you with the menu in Chinese if you wish. Beware the great vegetable dishes are not on the menu either so you have to ask what they have tonight they had five dishes we had a pea sprout dish for the vegetable and a number of other actually wonderful dishes. Food was outstanding everything tasted great filled with flavor I would have to say this is one of the finest Chinese restaurant I have been to, but don't look for frills in the service or anything like that although I found the service to be acceptable.  We were there on a Monday night and after we arrived there was a crowd  forming outside, so you want to time your visit or plan to wait, but I think it's worth the wait.

Finally and best of all it's not the kind of Chinese food that leaves you feeling bloated and full. I mean it's obviously not loaded with preservatives and MSG which is a plus at least if you're ordering off the Chinese menu.
author: J S.

description: Food was terrible. We went there at 11am right as they opened. They gave us the dinner menu and acted like there were no lunch specials. We realized other people were getting specials when we paid. I asked for water and they filled our water glasses from the same faucet they were using to clean the bathroom. A woman came right out of the bathroom with rubber gloves on and was handling the same faucet. Gross! Did I mention the food was terrible?
author: Iv L.

description: LOVE this place. The Eggplant/Black Pepper Tofu/Butternut Squash are my favorite dishes. Depending on the time you get here there will be a line outside but it moves rather quickly. They do kind of rush you and aren't the friendliest servers in the world but the food is amazing. Every time I'm in SF I make time to come here.
author: Lauren R.

description: Yummy food and a very nice waitress! We had these egg rolls that weren't rolls at all. Peggy recommended them and I loved them. It had eggs and vermicelli noodles. Pretty good eats. This was not your typical Chinatown dishes, very different. Would definitely done again.
author: Nancy F.

description: Was here 22 years ago and just came back for the first time since. As good as the first time, if not better. Everything was delish and very fresh. You go here for the food and the price.... Not the atmosphere. A must when in San Fransisco!
author: Deborah B.

description: Even though it may seem daunting on the outside, foreigners to Chinatown shouldn't be wary of this restaurant. Nestled between little stores and bakeries, House of Nanking offers a simple yet enticing menu. I ordered the steamed pork dumplings and the sesame chicken and the fried rice. As someone who is used to Americanized Chinese food like Panda Express, this was simply amazing! Everything I saw the waiters bring from the kitchen looked delicious. The restaurant itself has a lot of character and seems to be loved by travelers and locals alike based on the amount of customers we encountered. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who finds themselves hungry in Chinatown! You won't regret ordering the sesame chicken or dumplings!! Or, be brave and try something out of the ordinary. It is guaranteed to be amazing.
author: Juliana B.

description: Absolutely delicious.  The dumplings were unexpectedly tasty.  The chicken thing recommended by waitress a winner.  Chowder excellent.  Order the tea for sure
author: John T.

description: Here's the deal with House of Nanking.  It's not to be missed.  I learned of it because a tour guide on the Hop on Hop off said it's the only place he would recommend in all of China Town.  So I took that to heart. The food is off the hook.  They took traditional American Chinese food and kicked it up notches beyond mankind (to quote Emeril).  It's all in how the Chef constructed the sauces. The food will come hot, quick, and better than any Chinese food you've had. Don't complain about the service. It's not that kind of place.  Go there to eat the best Chinese you've had, not to be coddled, and you will not be disappointed.
author: Rich F.

description: Small, long line, yet was worth the wait! Great food at extremely fair prices! Probably the best value in this part of the bay! Though nit kid friendly,  the boss lady though extremely busy,  tried to help us out;)
author: Mr Sharon O.

description:
I don't see what the fuss is about.  They make you wait, the service is borderline rude and the food is hit or miss.  It's def better than some spots I have tried in Chinatown, but frankly I have been generally underwhelmed in Chinatown.

On a positive note, some people in my group loved the dumplings -- try those.
author: Steve K.

description:
Omg. I was wonderfully surprised by everything. Luckily an older lady ordered for us. She asked what we liked and we replied "everything."  
The rice sizzling soup was eye opening. Could not believe my mind. Also had the fried rice, dumplings, noodles, beef, shrimp and chicken dishes and shared everything. 

In fact, during the soup i wanted to ask for a boba straw but refrained due to class.
author: Dan K.

description:
I walk in and they provide me with a menu. The menus only have about seven or so items listed. But thanks to my fellow Yelpers, I ask them if I could order the fried tofu with peanut sauce and WOW! Amazeballs. 

So, I continue to order - peashooters, steamed rice, house chow mein. The waitress asks, "Are you sure you'll finish it all?" Ha!!! Challenge accepted ma'am.
author: Daina H.

description: Staff somewhat rude, but I sort of felt like it was  part of the experience.   Very busy place.  The sesame chicken was quite tasty, eggplant, green beans both were good.  I did not care for the fried green onion pancake (I'm a big fan of scallion pancake) it was crispy but lacked flavor and that good chewiness. I'd say give it a try.
author: Art-Suzanne R.

description: Came to this SF institution.  Parking is tough, but there is a garage is nearby.  It's a hole in the wall place with excellent food.  Ordered the goji berry tea, onion pancake with is peanut sauce and the Nanking chicken.  The order came very fast.  Within 10 minutes. The goji berry tea is great.  Served in a mug with the goji inside.  I was hesitant at first but it's very good.  The onion pancake is a nice and crispy on the outside and super green onion inside.  A good appetizer.  The Nanking chicken is the star of this show.  It's a boneless deep fried chicken with sweet sauce.  Almost like sweet and sour chicken without the sour.  It is also accompanied with fried yam smothered in sauce.  If the yam wasn't drenced in sweet sauced it would have gotten 5.  But you know, your here for the chicken and not the yam.  If your in Chinatown and you need to check Zagat rated place, SON!
author: Chris P.

description:
The man is obsessed with this place 
He has been coming for 24 years from LA. Yes you read that right 24 years 
When we first met 12 years ago he would wake up and say "We are driving to San Francisco today to eat at House of Nanking" and we would literally take a trip and and stay a might or two so he could eat here twice 
He would have dreams of their food 
No joke 
I know I'm sounding crazy at this point but it's true. 

Anyway they have become much more commercial now - expanded into the retail space next door so they have many more tables than more 

The best dishes are the Sesame chicken, shrimp packets, pea shoots and crispy beef which was crossed off the menu for some reason. Hope they don't permanently remove it from the menu 

If you like a little higher end go to their new restaurant Fang which was also pretty good 

Yum!!!! I will always love House of Nanning!!!!
author: Marie C.

description:
I don't think I have ever been as disappointed in a restaurant more than at the House of Nanking. From the moment you arrive you know this isn't going to be a good experience.  The lady who runs the front is sickened by the sight of you and let's you know it.  She tells you to wait outside, then grunts at you when she has a table open. Next, she'll proceed to throw the menus at you before walking away in disgust. 

The staffs treatment of you is almost comical or Saturday Night Liveish, but it isn't a joke and it is happening to you. Why am I not getting to the food?? Because it is as pedestrian as it gets. Multiple items on the menu aren't even available. And yes, when you order something they don't have, they get pissed, walkaway, and punish you by making you wait 10 minutes or more to get your chance to order again. You better get it right this time!! And whatever you do, don't you dare ask for ice cubes to go with your water!

Finally, the cleanliness or lack of takes the cake. I'll have to say what I witnessed was a first. The angry server who was completely flabbergasted that I wanted ice in my warm glass of water is the same guy who clears the tables. Here's where it gets good.... Instead of using a clean cloth and some sort of disinfectant to clean the tables he gets much more creative. He takes the previously drunk from water glasses still on the table, sticks his hands in them, gets his hands wet with the saliva filled backwash water, then sprays that water on your table, but don't worry, he uses a filthy rag to mop up the saliva water that just cleaned your table. 

They never come back to see if you need anything or if the food is good. They don't care. The only time they care or pretend to be nice is when you get the bill. Then and only then do they feign interest in you. Worst experience ever and there are 228 other reviews that sound similar.
author: David W.

description: I must say that I am very disappointed in this place..it used to be my go-to Chinese food spot in the city but I had to locate another new one. I called in to get an order to go last night and when I called, I was told that their wait time was "very long" and I couldn't order ahead without paying first...I thought "then what's the point of calling the order in?" I only gave 2 stars because the food is good, but their customer service is HORRIBLE.
author: Rina B.

description:
Only reason why it doesn't get 5 stars is because it's not fancy. Which is just how I like it! Other than that, the food and service is 5 star spot on!

My husband had been before so he knew to order "bring us whatever." Which they were happy to do. They brought us two appetizers: a big fried wonton with shrimp and green peas thing (the sauce had peanut flavour, which my husband is allergic too. And we told them in advance so be careful if you have allergies. Use a taste tester) and the other appetizer was ridiculously delicious! Fried pocket with noodles inside, so good!

Entrees: some kind of fried beef with Bok choi. Oh so good! Second entree was chicken with zucchini in an amazing sauce. Did I mention the rice? Oh my god! Just heavenly. And I'm not a rice gal. 

All the dishes came out pretty quickly. And we were stuffed. Wish we had a larger party to get more dishes to share! Despite my bursting belly I insisted on ordering dumplings. Had been reading all the wall by table, the newspaper articles raving about the dumplings. So I ordered pork dumplings. My tastebuds were glad that I did. 

Can't rave about the food enough. Will definitely go back before heading back home from our San Francisco vacation. 

You can't go wrong!
author: Adrianne D.

description:
We went here on the recommendation of the concierge at our hotel while on vacation in SF. We wanted a taste of Chinese food, and she suggested this one. We arrived and at first glance were hesitant to go in... it was a 'hole in the wall' type restaurant, and as soon as we opened the door it was evident this was a real neighborhood place, authentic chinese food with no ambiance. We had actually made a reservation, but it was obviously not necessary - this was not a place that one made reservations at. We were actually seated right away, and before we had a chance to take a breath the waitress was trying to take our order! I had read on the reviews that they turned the tables over quickly but this was a bit too much. Anyway, I politely told her we had just sat down. She was actually fine with that, brought us some requested tea, and only came back when she saw we were ready. The tea was served in big glass mugs (almost like a beer mug) rather than traditional tea cups, but the tea was excellent, and very hot! There was a blooming flower inside, coming out of the wrapped tea leave holder which was pretty cool. 
We ordered Onion Rice cakes ( A bit too onion-y for our tastes), wonton soup (fantastic!!!), chinese pork dumplings (Terrific!) and egg rolls (mostly pork, good flavor but not what we were used to). We also split an entree of their special sesame chicken (very flavorful) served with white rice (clumpy, not hot, but serviceable). Considering what we got, the bill was very reasonable. It took a bit of time for our server to give us our check, but we sure didn't feel rushed like we had initially. She was very pleasant, chatted with us a bit, and was very efficient throughout. In fact the other server that brought our food was very nice as well. We noted a line of people waiting outside to get in, soon after we had sat down. Most waited 15-20 minutes to get a table, but the line kept forming. The place stayed busy but they moved people along nicely. As mentioned we never felt rushed after the initial encounter.
If you want authentic chinese food in a typical neighborhood restaurant in Chinatown, we would definitely recommend it! There are lots of restaurants in the area of course, but I would not hesitate to return.
author: Rand T.

description:
Love this place. Had dinner there last might and it's just as I remember it from years ago. Good food and long lines because of it.

Have about six or seven dishes. My favorite was the crispy noodle with chicken and second to their orange chicken.

The owner I'd met over ten years back is still there taking orders and keeping you fed fast. 

My sons had a pre birthday celebration so got presents and his staff said happy birthday which was nice.
author: Jesse D.

description: Let the chef build our menu and just serve us blind. Dish after dish was absolutely amazing! So coming back on my next visit to SFO!
author: Boone A.

description:
I'll start by saying that the service left more to be desired but the food......OMG, delicious!!! I got the sesame chicken with the sweet potatoes and a friend and I shared chicken fried rice. The helpings were plenty and was seasoned to perfection. I would certainly return to this restaurant. 
The decor was average. I'm not a hug fan of sitting at tables with strangers especially when they chew with their mouth open and smack in your ear. But really, it was all worth it because the food was that good. I was obviously impressed.
author: M C.

description: Generous portions of Highly flavorful food from authentic noisy Chinese environment servings are quite large the illustration shows what was left over after four people had a full meal. Recommend the sesame chicken.
author: Robert K.

description:
Excellent food. Very reasonably priced. Customer service - meh, but who cares when the food is so good! 

Six of us went there for dinner the other night: two bottles of wine, several dishes. Cost? About $100. Insane. 

Expect a line out the door. We showed up about 5pm and only had to wait about 20 minutes. But when we left around 7pm or so, there was a long line out the door.
author: Kate T.

description:
I got the scallop tower. There were three jumbo scallops on top of lemon slices on top of eggplants, all smothered with some sweet-and-sour/oyster sauce. It was surrounded by an alfalfa salad, which was salted a bit too much.

Overall, I'd say the food is delicious. If you ignore the fact that it isn't Chinese.
author: Tony J.

description: Decent place. Wasn't the friendliest service but food was cooked quickly even at a busy hour. Dry fried pork spare ribs, only on Chinese menu, were very good.
author: Michael C.

description: It was good. I had lunch here with a colleague from work. He hadn't been there in 20years and now that he is back in San Francisco this had to be his first stop. He said it was a place frequented by celebrities. Not Anymore! Anyway, this is another place that I've walked past and it's always busy, especially during dinner. I gave it 4 stars because it was good and they delivered the things that I like, well seasoned, sauce that I can eat with my rice, and good service. However they give plastic cups. The tall kind that kids love to drink punch out of. That's very odd. The one my colleague had was peeling around the rim. Nasty! I didn't say anything so that I don't gross him out but I also noticed he didn't drink out of the cup. Apparently the Chef and his Daughter were on a Chopped cooking show. I guess everyone eats here because of its history but I didn't get a, "Wow that was Awesome food," experience. Sorry... I don't see it.
author: Mag D.

description: Totally authentic, divey Chinese food perfection. We ordered the shrimp dumplings as an appetizer and it was perfectly crisp and the shrimp, peas and other veggies were super fresh and light. I had the Mongolian Beef over crunchy noodles for lunch and it was hot, fresh and perfectly spiced. This place is small, packed and the staff is more than ready to move you on your way, but it's worth it.
author: Molly M.

description:
Stop searching for a restaurant and come here!!! You won't be disappointed!

The place looks like a hole in the wall, but its amazing. I'm sure the food is heavily laced with MSG but OMG its delicious. I come up to San Francisco several times a month, and I always make it to Nanking. 

My favorite dish is the Salt and Pepper Shrimp mushrooms. So Good :P I have yet to try anything on the menu that has been a disappointment. All I can say is amazing!

The staff is most definitely not hospitable, they're rude, and they never really smile. BUT they're quick to help you, and cater to your every need.
author: Karo K.

description: I went there five years ago during my first visit to San Francisco, and fell in love with the food there. This time I came back and went straight for the famous Nanking Sesame Chicken with fried sweet potato crisps. My appetizer of fried shrimp packet drenched in peanut sauce was so delicious, as well as the won ton soup. The service was prompt and courteous, and the ambience of the restaurant was cozy and relaxing. I highly recommend House of Nanking!
author: James F.

description:
I'd walked by this place before, but the persistent line is always discouraging. We finally decided to give it a go based on high praise from a friend. As it turned out, we got lucky and there was no line and we were seated immediately.

But frankly, you'd better know what you want before you walk through the door. And bring your own water. There were four of us, they brought three waters (and two menus). It took us several tries of hounding everyone we could see (most of whom ignored us) before we got that fourth water...complete with floating, dead bug. We got the menus too, but only for a couple minutes before they came by and took two back. And when my poor dad had a question while trying to decide between two items on the menu, the waiter decided enough was enough, snatched the menu right out of his hand, and left. We had no idea what my dad was even getting until they brought it.

As it turned out, he ended up with the Bao Bing Wrap, which was delicious. The meat literally melts in your mouth. The rest of the dish is a waste of time, though; some lettuce and flimsy flour tortillas. We also had the Salt & Pepper Shrimp, Sesame Chicken, and House Noodles. The chicken was good, though the shrimp was definitely the best dish. The noodles were ok; not bad, but not memorable. We also tried the pot stickers, but weren't impressed.

Bottom line, if you know when to go and what you want, then the food is worth it. But if you're looking to try it out for the first time, best of luck to you. Be ready for a wild ride and some seriously entitled restaurant staff. An "experience" unlike any other anywhere else I have ever been.
author: Brian S.

description:
This is the best Chinese food I've ever eaten. It's so good, that any other Chinese food place will be ruined. You'll keep finding yourself saying, "Well that wasn't as good as House of Nanking." In other words, if you are planning a trip to San Fran you should definitely put this on your list of things to do/see/eat.

Pro Tip: Come 15 minutes before they open to avoid waiting.
author: Ryan D.

description: House of Nan King has some of the most interesting, flavorful Chinese dishes you can find in San Francisco. The signature Nan King chicken is a unique mix of traditional and California flavors that can't be missed. I loved Nan King back when it looked more like a luncheonette and the owner still waited tables, but though it might have lost of some it's unique charm of late the food is still incredible and very reasonable priced.
author: Peter G.

description:
I'm not kidding when I say this is the best Chinese cuisine I've ever had. Ever. I'm a touring musician and record producer; I've eaten around the country at dozens and dozens of Chinese joints and hands down House of Nanking tops them all. 

Don't be surprised if you order something and they tell you they're bringing that but 'will bring you something better'. They never fail at it. Whatever they bring you whether it's what you ordered or not is absolutely incredible. Savory, fresh, explosion of flavor. They're constantly rearranging the tables inside to accommodate as my people as possible. You'll very likely end up sitting smack dab next to someone who's a total stranger. They're also not shy about telling you there's a line out the door and you gotta pay and go. 

The whole endeavor is wonderful and authentic. If you're in SF it's a must go to spot. You won't be disappointed. Just go in open minded and ready for whatever.
author: Michael P.

description:
There seems to be a huge line for this place on most days. My friend and I just happened to stop in just before there was a crowd. The tables are really close to each other, so much that you can basically reach over and grab someone else's dish if you really wanted to. We stuck up a conversation with a couple that were in town from Florida so I gave them some non-tourist ideas.

The menu is full of a wide variety of items to choose from. I went with the classic House Noodles which were tasty and garlicky. My friend got the sesame chicken which was probably the best dish there. It seems a bit more Americanized so if that's what you like, then stop in. Otherwise, walk down the street Chinatown for some authentic Chinese food.

They serve you fast and the prices are pretty reasonable.
author: Amy J.

description:
For a decade I've having been entertaining my Friends at this place..  Last visit I wasn't very successful..  The lady at the door ("the hostess/owners wife") you are very unprofessional in the way you dress and act! You should greet your loyal customers with a smile.. I walked in and out with a bad taste in my mouth.. On top of that she threw the menu on the table like she was feeding the pigs as we were sitting down..
Also my girl friend asked the waiter what type of food was popular and the he replied
Sesame chicken and made her  choice   Without giving her options to see what he was  recommending..
I have no idea why they are always rushing 
On their customers and they don't allow her even take a minute to think about the choices..
"I found the other waiter tall Asian guy wearing glasses to be the  one professional
And caring around this place.. He deserves 6 stars.. If he owned this place id be he served better food then" Slanted door."
I had the BBQ pork with sweet potato and onions" I didn't taste it" .. It wasn't bad but not amazing... 
During the dinner the hostess walking around the restaurant  eating back and forth with two chop stick like you would do in your house. It was very full and I found it very disgusting and Lack of respect for the customers who pays the big bucks.. I never seen any thing like that in a restaurant in San Francisco. 
I'm not ranting on the business but The Customer is always right! To top it off you shouldn't push us like animals out the door. We won't be back that's for sure!
author: Pedro D.

description:
It's like you've never had Chinese food before- so flavorful, delicious, fresh-- just really tasty!
 Have been many times, and each time is amazing.
author: S R.

description:
This place is basically a landmark in Chinatown with lines out the door for dinner. Luckily, it's way less crowded at lunch and you can actually get a table pretty quickly. Unluckily, it's just not very good.

I ordered their famous Sesame Chicken- crispy fried chicken in a honey and sesame sauce. It sounded so great. I mean, how can you go wrong with fried chicken? In a honey sauce? Unfortunately, it just didn't measure up. The chicken was an odd mix of white and dark meat such that some pieces were completely overcooked and others were fatty and undercooked. The sauce was almost nonexistent and barely coated the chicken. From what little sauce I could taste, it tasted like pure sugar with zero depth of flavor. And on top of it all, it was served with sweet potatoes. I mean, what sort of place charges you extra for white rice but throws in random sweet potatoes as a side?

The food did not live up to the hype. There are so many great restaurants in Chinatown serving both authentic Chinese food and the Panda Express brand of Chinese food, there's just no point wasting your time at this place.
author: Nadeem A.

description:
Flash!!!!

This restaurant sold! Peter is out, all his awards are off the walls. The menu is changed. It's not the same at all....

Do not eat here. It's all gone... No more... Caput!!!

Peter moved south of market. Go there!

More of SFs soul has died, not much left...
author: J F.

description: I always take anyone visiting SF here and everyone I have taken there so far has enjoyed the food here! This place has one of the best Chinese food I have ever had.
author: mary a.

description:
Honesty, this is the best food, basically ever. In the history of always, this is the best food--ever. 
The costumer service wasn't too prime, but the food and prices are like nothing you could believe. The honest to goodness best in China Town, if not the whole city. 
Be prepared for a line out the door and being squished in like a can of sardines, but it's worth it.
author: Rebecca A.

description: I love this place -- the food is fresh and has a very original taste and fairly priced -- it can bet busy but is worth the wait.  Excellent appetizers -- enjoyed the shrimp pockets -- and the sesame chicken is great.
author: Chris C.

description: The food was amazing! When you ordered, the food came out very quickly. I'm not Chinese but I feel like the food wasn't authentic and was very Americanized. But please don't get me wrong, everything was still very tasty! Also, when you order hot tea, they leave the plant in your tea with all its roots. It may not be what you are accustomed to, but I thought it brought a special touch.
author: Katrina W.

description:
*ahem*

If you're looking for warm, inviting, personable service - then this is NOT the place for you.

BUT - if you like super tight eating spaces and long waits and you want to assault your tastebuds with the most tantalizing, throat coating, delightfully tasty Chinese food in all of San Francisco, then THIS IS the place for you!

Hell yeah!!!
author: Mike M.

description: The main dishes are pretty good. However, the rice was not fully cooked. More importantly, hygene was terrible there. My brother saw the busboy's fingers in the glasses (as he was fllling them with water). One of our chopsticks had traces of rice from a previous customer on it.
author: Ludovic T.

description: Don't understand what the big deal is about this place. It's like Panda Express but more expensive. There's sometimes a time for Panda-like comfort food, but not when you actually want authentic, good Chinese food.
author: Malcolm O.

description: This place is and will likely always be my favorite place to eat in San Francisco. It is the best Chinese food I've had in my entire life. The food is amazing, the staff is great (I had a minor issue and they fixed it right away), and the price is great. I've been coming here for 10 years and don't plan to stop anytime soon.
author: Cisco R.

description:
Date night with the hubby, who works as a tour bus driver in S.F. He's the one who mentioned this place. My first time eating here. His, too.

Heard this place is famous and has a line out the door when it opens. Fortunately, we just sauntered in with no waiting. However, on the way out, there was indeed a line out the door. 

The food was VERY good. I didn't know they had a hidden menu which I will definitely ask for next time. The ambiance was lacking, as they had us packed in there like sardines with no room to move, which is what the 4 stars are for. If someone farts at the table, it will end up in your food because everything is packed too closely. Makes it impossible to service you, except to set your food down at the end of the table and slide it over to you. Had a snap pea salad with red onion that was drowning in grease, but very good. Had the garlic fish and salt and pepper shrimp. DELISH!

I guess I should expect not to be able to understand a single word they say. We just kept saying "huh?" through most of the meal. 

It was a little pricier than I had expected and the portions weren't as big as I'm used to, but I enjoyed myself. I'd go again...and ask for the ancient chinese secret menu.
author: Michele P.

description:
I'm not the type of person who nitpicks about service, but holy cow does this place have an awful, uncomfortable atmosphere. The older gentleman who took our drink and food orders acted like he'd rather be anywhere else in the world, and he was extremely curt in all his interactions with us. 

And, most ridiculous of all, when we, a party of two who hadn't eaten all day, and were pretty hungry from hiking, tried to order two apps and two entrees, HE SAID NO. He said it was too much food. What?! I've never experienced anything like that in my life.

The food itself - scallops with greens, sesame chicken with sweet potatoes, steamed dumplings - was pretty good, and for that I'll give it 2 stars instead of 1, but I would never in a million years recommend this place to anyone.

Again, I'm not one to nitpick on service. My family has owned restaurants for 50+ years, and I know what the business is like. But this was unbelievable.
author: Jason C.

description: Delicious food! The line is worth it! The sesame chicken is so crispy and tasty. Next time im in san fran ill be there. Yummy in my tummy!
author: Susan W.

description: Delish!  I was craving some chinese since it's hard to find in San Diego.  Wandered in on a Monday afternoon.  Ordered the chicken nanking, salt & pepper shrimp and fried onion cake. The chicken nanking was out of this world. The other two dishes were just alright. Not really worth the trek.  Great if you want some affordable chinese in the heart of the city.
author: Jane E.

description:
I have never been to a restaurant that is more ruder than this one. Staff had attitude problems and apparently didnt know the food.  Before serving it to our table, the waiter stirred the soup up to look at what kind of soup it was.   The soup came out like someone barfed on it. LOST my appetite!

Was waiting for the change to come back and leave tips with dollar bills bc we needed the coins for parking. Looked at us like we were begging for our money....

Oh and my wonton soup, horrible for the price of 8.95. 4 wontons and 2 scallops and that's it...no noodles!!!
author: D K.

description:
Expect to wait , and salivate over the smell of the fresh ingredient.

The service is,was and will be beyond horrible.
(get ready for slogans like , "finish food and pay"). 

The food is to die for , why ?   ...it is fresh , cooked very hot and fast ,
with balanced spices and amounts to intrigue your taste senses to want more.

Therefore I put up any time with the rest of any potential issues of this hole in the wall 
place. 
If I take visitors there I prep them , 
by telling them  : 

1.long wait, 
2.tight seating , 
3.loud ,
4.don't use the bathroom, 
5.order fresh fish of the day and as many as possible appetizer, 
6.have tee to enhance your taste senses  , 
7.pay and leave to walk to Coit tower and north beach for coffee to chill out.
author: Klaus S.

description:
Best asian food I've had in a long time!

Service isn't the best/most courteous as the place is probably victim of its own success. Usually quite busy!

Still a place I love to go to!
author: Sofiane F.

description: The food was mediocre for the price. shrimp was flavorless and disappointing. the owner was rude and forced us to leave a tip. find somewhere else.
author: Dylan H.

description:
Every time I am in SF, I make sure to eat at the House of Nanking. I cannot believe this is my first time reviewing the restaurant. Heck, I have been rocking one of their tshirts for years. Sadly, I cannot give it a good review at this time.

Unfortunately, the last time I went, I had a similar experience to that of a recent review. I showed up at 11:55am, I believe they open at 12p, and the woman seemed disgusted that I was there. They do not have their hours posted on the door and I attempted to ask what time they open, only to be shunned. The lady had a serious bad attitude. She is tall and has short black hair.

The food is great and everyone else in the restaurant is friendly. But Mr. Nanking, for the sake of your business, you need to address the attitude of the tall woman working in your establishment. My wife and I spoke about her attitude and negativity and I almost considered leaving as a result of her unfriendly demeanor.
author: Justin R.

description:
There is a line out the door as if they are giving away concert tickets!  I was prepared for this though, since it was recommended to me by a co-worker and I'd read about the popularity of this restaurant.

On a weekday around 5:00 or 6:00 p.m., I think we waited 45 minutes in line.  Think about it, you wait that long to get into Olive Garden or any Lettuce Entertain You restaurant.  So get over it.

The food was good, and there was plenty of it, but we felt hurried to eat.  Very crowded in the dining area, and the service wasn't anything to complain about, but not too great either.
author: Angela P.

description: Incredibly fast. We didn't even have to decide between the 5 of us. They recommended "we'll bring you this this this and this to share". We said yes and I ended up leaving with a shirt I was so happy. Great food. Try egg rolls, pot stickers, dumplings, fried rice, sesame chicken. Or anything on the menu, it'll be great.
author: Jon S.

description: I am really surprised to see all the hype about this place.  It was maybe average.
author: Meredith J.

description: Crunchy beef with bok Choy was the absolute best. The bok Choy was still crisp and not overcooked. Potstickers - pass - nothing special. Eggplant was amazing! Skip the sesame chicken - overrated.
author: Andrea B.

description: Be honesty it is not authentic Chinese food but..it taste good!!This restaurant surprised me on my first bite, it is strange but yeah, still good food. I like it and I will recommend it to my friend.
author: Yunru C.

description:
This place has jumped the shark. 
It's all about sucking the money out of gullible non-Chinese. The food is bad.
Hot & Sour Soup with frozen peas and white chicken breast instead of pork and wood ear mushrooms? 
You've got to be kidding. 
The "famous" sesame chicken was just gross glop.
No chopsticks. Really?  
They're pinching every conceivable penny.
Unbelievably surly and rude "service." 
They barely look at you. They avoid eye contact.
They don't even set the table. They just fling the plates and utensils at you. 
You can feel the contempt for the customers. 
It's really bad. Never again.
author: David F.

description:
I trust my lawyer with my life.  Always on top of his game, give me sound legal advice, and loves to play golf and down a few drinks.  Attorney, why, oh why did you let some doubt creep into my thought of you by taking me to "the best Chinese restaurant in Chinatown"?  

It's because of people like him.  It's because of tourists following the latest guide book.  It's because of hotel concierges wanting to send their customers to a "safe" restaurant.  These are the people who are pimping this place that causes long lines out the door of mainly fair skinned light haired people who think General Tso actually fought in the Han Dynasty.

If Chef  Boyardee opened an Italian restaurant, would there be lines of Chinese lined up to get in? Only if he had a publicist like House of Nanking's.  Save your money and go to Panda Express.
author: Ron L.

description: I walked in not expecting much as I am still fairly new to the city, and have been disappointed in recent meals. The host gave us our menus, asked if we have ever eaten there before, then for our dietary preferences (we had 2 vegetarians), and as fast as he had given us our menus he took them away. He returned with Green Tea in a stein, and the tea flower opened and blossomed within the cup as it heated up. The dishes were all fantastic. A veggie medley appetizer, followed by ramen soup, a tofu dish, kung pao chicken, and white rice. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a great SF Chinese food experience.
author: Alex N.

description: Usually no wait for a table of two. Blossom Tea is a must. Orange Chicken! You have to try this. Very tasty. I could eat here once a week.
author: Don W.

description:
Completely awful in every single way. 

First of all, the woman who sat us was too impatient to take one extra step to table to set down our menu. Instead, she tossed it and completely missed. So we had to use menus that had just been on the ground. 

After viewing the menu, you will quickly learn that there are only about 10 items to choose from. I ordered the fried pork egg roll and beef chow mein. Both terrible. The chow mein tasted like A1 sauce and the texture of the noodles was straight mush. 

Our waitress did not check on us once or refill our waters. We got our check that was $38. Didn't tip. Left the restaurant, checked my bank account and they charged me $47. 

Went back and asked them to show me my receipt. It showed no tip and they insisted that they only charged $38. I told them that if my bank account still says $47 by tomorrow I am coming back in for a full refund. 

I will keep you updated.
author: C W.

description: THE BEST!!!!!!!! The food here is amazing. Everything was fresh. I had the sesame chicken, which could've been split between 2 people. It was so much food. Staff was decent; wasn't really expecting a whole lot. Food came out in 10 mins from ordering.
author: Kim P.

description: This is an excellent hole-in-the-wall chinese restaurant. The food (Lunch) was good, but not spectacular. We enjoyed the Fried shrimp and mushrooms as well as the sesame chicken. We were drawn to it because of the zagat rating, and proximity to the hotel. I'm sure that depending on the dish, it can be better, but for us, it was about average, or a little above. There were few actual partitions, creating a quasi-open atmosphere, but the tables were a little crowded.
author: Ryan K.

description: Eaten here several times, never disappointed. - Every time we go here the chef asks us if we've been there before. We've learned to just say no and he takes our menus from us and asks "what don't you want to eat" and then just brings us whatever he wants to. I really like this style and it's reasonably affordable but recent popularity has made it harder to get in and more expensive to eat. Still, good place.
author: John M.

description: Food was okay, interesting twist on sesame chicken and hot and sour soup. Service was awful, all the servers treated us pretty bad. They were even rude to the other people in there, sat a mans plate down next to us and immediately turned away (wouldn't refill waters, or give us menus) it was a struggle to get any kind of service. Seem to prefer Chinese customers over other races.
author: Quinton L.

description:
I'm an avid food lover and because of the reviews on Yelp, decided to try this place out. If you're reading this, I'm begging you to stay away, stay far away. The food was so horrible we left most of the food on the table and left. It wasn't even edible. We had the fried dumplings, wonton soup, hot and sour soup, Nan king pork, and sesame chicken.
None of it tasted as ad you would expect. Th hit and sour soup had zucchini and chicken in it.. Seriously? Anyone who knows Chinese food, knows those ingredients should never be in hot and sour soup.

Aside from the horrible food the service was abysmal. Our waitress was rude , curt and flat out just miserable to even look at. She had this "I could careless if you were in my restaurant , hurry up and order do I can go home attitude"

If suggest you go somewhere where there's a lot of Asian folk in the restaurant, it's usually a good indicator. This place was all tourist and mainly Americans....
Uggggh
author: Bick L.

description:
We are just leaving Nanking on a somewhat busy Sunday evening. I'll preface my review with the admission that we read the reviews before we came and knew what to expect (a wait, short service and a cramped space). 

We arrived and were greeted just fine by the hostess we'd read so much about. We were seated within 5 minutes and our drinks were immediately taken. 

We ordered sesame chicken, fried rice, shrimp and dumplings. All of the food came out quickly but fresh and hot. Very decent Chinese food! Space was cramped but not too bad. Our service was just a bit hurried, not rude. 

We were even given complimentary chopsticks at the end of our meal! Just come in with a little patience, a smile and an empty stomach and you'll have a great (if quick) time!
author: Cheyenne C.

description: Love this place. As long as you aren't picky and have no food allergies, the chef prepares some great grub! Highly recommend for the adventurer eater.
author: Dara U.

description: This place is really a dump, but the sizzling rice veg soup was just what I needed. I would recommend for a quick snack, or quick lunch, but there are nicer places to go for a long lunch. I would not go for dinner.
author: Alyssa K.

description: I have been coming to this place off and on since the early 1990's.  I have recommended it to many over the years.  What I first fell in love with about this place is that they will pick stuff for you, just tell them what you don't like.  We have always gotten great food in the right portion amount for the size group.  This place is always busy and so the staff isn't all warm and fuzy but they are quick and I for one appreciate that.  Not the newest place in town and does not have fancy food but good food that everyone, no matter how picky will like to eat.
author: Bridget L.

description:
It's sort of funny to me reading the negative reviews here...because many of them make valid points! We've been coming to House of Nanking since we moved to the Bay Area 25 years ago. I think the food has always been consistently amazing. It's creative and innovative and I've had the feeling many times that I'm eating Chinese food for the first time. It's really not Chinese food as much as its fusion-American-Chinese. It's always packed, almost always has a line out front and it's really sort of rare to see many Asian faces there. Peter Fang is brilliant and I clearly remember him 25 years ago NOT allowing me to order what I wanted from the menu. I'd say, "I'd like the Mongolian Beef" and he'd say No, you get Nanking Chicken instead. What? I can't order what I want here? Hilarious! The place used to be about half the size it is today and the tables were lined up right next to each other to insure the maximum number of diners could be served. You got to know the strangers next to you pretty quick and often we would share food! No question, service was rude too...but who cared! We were having SO MUCH FUN and the food was so good! 

There isn't a member of our family nor good friends who have come to visit over the years that we haven't brought to House of Nanking. We give them the tour, Golden Gate Bridge, Lombard Street, Coit Tower...etc, and we always finish the day off with dinner at House of Nanking. Last night was my daughters 15th birthday and we asked her what she wanted to do. She said she wanted to bring her best friends to House of Nanking. As usual, we waited in line to get in, got crammed together at one of their long tables next to some strangers and got lucky...Peter Fang himself waited on us! I haven't seen one of their menus in years.  I just tell Peter to bring us whatever he wants! The pot stickers might come out after the entrees and only half our drink order arrived...but who cares. Everything we got was fantastic and fresh tasting! The vegetables are perfection...not overcooked. I can't really tell you what we had....but it was delicious. 

My only suggestion is, put aside your preconceptions about eating in a restaurant and let this place do its thing. It's well worth it.
author: Jim M.

description: Service clearly is atrocious. The food is quite good but not outstanding - lacks spices - we had the tofu in black bean sauce and sesame chicken and the beef wrap and also pork dumplings which were good.
author: Thomas C K.

description: With a well know reputation, House of Nanking is one of the first and few places I've ever bookmarked on Yelp, and I'm glad I did.  The bf and I went and were lucky to be seated at the one empty table in the busy restaurant on a weekend night, and get right in without a wait.  There were several seafood and vegetarian options on the menu and prices were very reasonable.  We both ordered hot and sour soup which was perfect for a cold windy evening.  I ordered the five spiced pork and the bf opted for the famous sesame chicken with sweet potatoes (there is a reason they have branded it famous). Dishes are a la carte. Unfortunately, I wasn't too excited about it as much of it had some large pieces of fat.  I was extremely jelly of the bf's dish, which he so kindly shared a good portion of it with me... so good.  The house red wine was standard, but great for $3.75 and a generous pour.  The service was fairly quick and no-nonsense.   During the course of our dinner, there always seemed to be a line outside.  I'm not claiming that this was the best Chinese food I've ever eaten, but it was satisfyingly good food (minus the pork dish), speedy service, and affordable in an easily accessed location.
author: Nova P.

description: Went again and it's quite possibly the best Chinese lunch I've ever had.  Barely beat the long wait times for lunch.  This place is a destination Chinese restaurant.  Kinda hole in the wall, but not too bad.  The food is superb and service is fast.
author: Gregory N.

description:
OMG! Best chinese food ever. Must try the following 3:

-Sesame chicken
-Green beans dish
-Shrimp & mushroom

Everything is packed with so much delicious flavor. The shrimp has a bit of a kick to it but more mild than spicy.

Impressed!!!
author: Sadia M.

description:
I really love food that's Chinese. You'll note I didn't say that I love chinesefood. You know what I'm talking about, right? Whereas good food prepared in a Chinese way is a sublime and delightful experience, chinesefood more often than not is a greasy, if not somewhat indulgent experience best left for those moments when it's the sole desire of your belly.

House of Nanking is the previous, and while it's not the universe's most shining example of crafty and creative Chinese food, it's pretty darn good. chinesefood places are a dime a dozen, and Nanking is more like a several dollar find.

Speaking of money, it's not going to cost you a ton. Yes, chinesefood is cheaper, but our eggplant served with sweet potato was really remarkable, and the winner for the day was scallops. Sweet, soft, savory, and sublime all there on a plate for the plucking. Scallops can be so wrong (like chewing on a tire from my old Construx® blocks) but when they're right, they're just stellar. Hopefully they maintain their standards at Nanking because I'd love to come back for more.

Sweet Jenny L ordered a flowering tea and this was my first experience with the whole flowering tea phenomenon. For the uninitiated, you drop a tea ball into hot water, and over the course of he meal it slowly opens into a beautiful flower and a subtle tea. Like a science project, only for your beverage.

The staff was all smiles (though speedy during the lunch rush) and we were in and out and back to the office in a snap with bellies full of food that's Chinese. Not chinesefood.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: This is the best Chinese food I've ever tasted.. Seriously, every single dish is a delight.  You must definitely ask for the "flowering green tea."
author: Adriana B.

description: Solid lunch. When you ask for spicy you get spicy. Sichuan chicken is excellent; we also had Mongolian Beef, which is nearly as good.
author: Michael W.

description:
Within a few minutes of sitting down, I was super excited. I thought, "Hey, if they are always this rude, the food must be phenomenal". I assumed it was their schtick and honestly, if your food is mind blowing, I find that entertaining.

Don't get me wrong, the food was good, but other than the shrimp cake, it didn't blow my mind. It reminded me of Mission Chinese, just a little less creative. It did come out quickly, so much so, that I suspect the chef must be a legitimate psychic on his/her days off. In fact, the staff's two objectives seemed to be to interact with you as little as they could while trying to get you out the door as quickly as possible...again something I can tolerate if the food is fantastic.

I am glad I tried it and those shrimp cakes might tempt me back at some point, but this place won't be a regular stop. For the price and experience, there are just too many great options in San Francisco for Chinese and most of them are less expensive and much more friendly.
author: Dean B.

description: Go in and tell the lady you want to little of everything and that you've never been here before. She will say let me give you a little bit of pork a little bit of chicken and little bit of shrimp. You do that and you're golden.
author: Cindy K.

description: I love this place in SF china town. Sesame chicken is bomb! Chinese flower tea always catch people's attention. A must go place in the area. Expect wait line and foodgasm.
author: Ying Z.

description:
okay okay okay.

I really thought this place was going to suck when I first got here. Like honestly, I almost had to pour myself my own water from my water bottle because the service was that bad. If you are service person soley, this is not your place.

while ordering, I ordered 3 items and I was going to order another one and he said "your finished" and I game him the look you give someone when they call you something. 

Food comes, first is the sizzling rice soup. My friend says that it's spicy and I'm just like "umm I'm mexican"

this soup was the essence of what every spicy food should taste like. It was the epitome of perfection, like, what did they put in that thing! I finished that in a matter of seconds. 

From then on, it was just a roller coaster of lively and vivacious tastes ranging in spice level and the sesame chicken was the main man. 

It was beautiful, it was progressively spicier as I ate and there were tender tones of orange and lemon and the sweet potato paired perfectly.

this is officially my go to place for chinese. with food like this, they have a reason to be so bad with service. 

They are overflowing with customers!
author: Juan Carlos S.

description: OMG the noodles, how can I get these in Miami? The best veggie noodle dish I have ever had, period.
author: Erika T.

description: First things first on the relis, relis(Iggy and fancy) It was spring break and my wife thought that going to San Fran would be fun So now let's get to business! (I'm taking off work so I take that back!) It was Easter morning and we planned on going on the go carts. We got reservations at 2:00 but it was only 10:30. I was thinking small and I remember in 4th grade we learned about themes and one of them was before you do something, think of the pros and cons. I did that for Chinatown. The cons were that I wouldn't have so much time there but the pros were that we would have something to kill time. I decided that thou shall go. Let me tell y'all that the food was slow and the broccoli was good. The rice was hot but good. Everybody was talking in Chinese. The waitress was good
author: Madelyn F.

description:
House of Nanking doesn't sound like much for some reason but it is a really cool and really tasty place anyway.

The sign is UGLY! The facade is cool. The place has a pseudo run down look but it really isn't. It has lots of character. I like the lighting inside! I love the windows and we were lucky enough to sit by them. However, I had my back turned to the window so I didn't get to do much people watching and this is a great place to do that. So many people pass by!

We had Sesame Chicken with yams and it was awesome. We also had Chow Mein which was also awesome. We had a seafood soup which the waitress forced upon us in typical House of Nanking style haha! She said "I will take care of you" and then the Targetera tried to choose something else but the waitress insisted and all the Targetera could do was give in haha! We had some delicious braised green beans too! 

The food is so flavorful and different from Los Angeles Chinese food that I was surprised - big time! However, the sauce used for the Chow Mein and the Sesame Chicken tasted the same. Minus one star for that and minus one star for the pushy waitress. It may be what sets them apart but I really don't like that:( The seafood soup was not really that great and most of us agreed on that:(
author: Miguel R.

description:
The novelty of it is what attracts but the waiters with lousy attitude and impatience really suck.

Thanks for the response: we had the calamari, the chow mien, the Nanking beef and Shizwan chicken. We were inquiring about a type of beef that we had off menu last time we were here but the waiter would not give us a moment to ask any questions.
author: Hani B.

description:
Bottom Line: You gotta try it.

Since I order like a pro (see below), I don't know the names of the dishes, but the veggie dishes have been my favorite. Mushroom, tofu, and eggplant dishes. I think many would say their dishes are American-Chinese cuisine, with that said stay away from the ultra-stereotypical dishes like beef with broccoli.

Pro tip: Don't bother with the menu, just say you want food for _ people, and _ people are vegetarians. They will serve you some darn good food. This place is here to fill your belly not cater to your every need, so don't ask a lot of questions. You just mess up the vibe and flow.

This is the same owner as Fang (in SOMA). This restaraunt is a San Francisco establishment, they have been there a long time and stay in business by selling inexpensive tasty food.
author: Matthew T.

description: We were wandering around North Beach and stumbled into this place not knowing that it receives amazing reviews. We were not disappointed!
