First of all, this place is D-I-R-T-Y! Chef Ramsey would not be happy with this. The floors are sticky from all the grease, the tables are placed too close together and one of our tables was slanted! So we started off with some dumplings, wonton soup with crab (waitress was pushing for it), then for entrees we got eggplant in garlic sauce, chow mein, sesame chicken, and bao bing beef wraps.

The crab was little chopped crab with the shell on it. We couldn't eat the crab because we didn't have the utensils and we didn't want to break our teeth. Wonton was .. eh... don't remember much about it, so that's not a good sign. The dumplings were also .. just a-ok. I can make better ones. The eggplant had this weird sour taste to it. I think it's part of the sauce, but it's just odd that it stands out so much. The sesame chicken was NOT impressive and if you're looking for "authentic" chinese food, that's not really authentic people. chow mein was hard ... but then I find that's common. The noodles on the west coast is harder and chewier. It's like it's just filled with flour.

Definitely not a place I would take my out of town friends.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: I really enjoy this place.   Food is generally delicious although every now and again I'll get a dish I don't enjoy as much as others.  Experience is bare bones, and frequently includes a hilarious waiter who tells you what to order even if that's not what you want.   Reminds me of a friendly version of Seinfeld's "soup nazi".   I don't live in the city anymore but I always find myself back here when I'm in town for a visit and am rarely disappointed.
author: Graham D.

description: We ate here a few days ago on a Saturday in San Francisco. We got here before the dinner crowd so we didn't have the wait that other reviews mention. We started with the hot and sour soup. It wasn't the usual hot and sour that I've gotten at every other Chinese restaurant - it was much blander. The we had the fried onion cakes and fried pork potstickers. These were ok, just all tasted alike. Then we split the Famous Nanking Sesame Chicken. Unfortunately, even though we had arrived within an hour after they opened, it didn't taste very fresh. The service was rushed and inattentive. This place is way overrated! I can't understand why it's on so many must-eat lists.
author: Shannon M.

description:
Tried HON the other afternoon. Quite a few people suggested I go here, and the yelp reviews were high. 
I would rate my experience at a C. 

Service: D- Food: C+. 

We arrived about 45 minutes before closing(they close at 2 for lunch and reopen later). We checked the menu before coming so we could quickly order and eat and leave before 2. As someone else stated, we felt very rushed, the service was bordering on rude. The server, an older man, talked over us and interrupted us. I ordered the stacked noodles and the man quickly said "okay, beef!" and took off with my menu. I actually wanted chicken, but they were busy so I just waited for my food since it wasn't a huge deal and I had no idea where he went. 

Our pork egg rolls came out and they were frozen in the middle. I'm assuming they were trying to get food out quickly so they could rush everyone out the door. No one checked on our table so we had no way of letting anyone know that our egg rolls were frozen. 

The entrees came out and they were good! Very very very hot, temperature wise, though. But no real complaints here my noodles were spicy and full of flavor.

I totally 100% understand that when you are getting authentic food, you sometimes sacrifice service, most of my favorite restaurants staff people who are a little cranky. But sadly our food was not mind-blowing enough to make up for the service.
author: Kate S.

description:
Apparently there is quite the debate on where the most authentic Chinese food can be found in SF, and this place was a local colleague's pick.  
I don't think I ever would have taken a second glance at the place if it hadn't been recommended to me.  Luckily we got there pretty early, and the line to wait was very short, even for a medium size group.

It ended up being fantastic!  The server offered to give us a chef's selection of dishes, but we opted to order our own to accommodate the veggie, no-pork, and gluten-free requirements in our group.  Everything tasted great and was super affordable.

We also ordered some wine, which wasn't great (I think there were only a couple of choices), but at the price, there wasn't much to complain about.
author: Katie H.

description: We usually just let the chef decide for us. My favorite is the shrimp w tomatoes and crispy rice. very fresh and delicious. (I don't think it's on the menu!!)
author: K R.

description:
The place is small and very unique, which gave me the excitement of trying out new place. the owner was there to help us and helped to ordered all the foods, so we were in good hand and not worrying about what dishes to choose.

I usually dont like Chinese foods that much, but I did enjoy the dinner here with my group of friends. The  special mushroom appetizer was soo delicious.  we have more than 6-7 dishes, too bad, i dont remember the names since the owner helped us with all that. 

My friend said that place always has a very long line for dinner, but somehow that night we got in like 5 mins, guess we were lucky to try out this place.  


I Would come back   . If u like to try out Asian/Chinese cuisine with different tastes and special dishes, not too fancy or wayyy too special, but i considered it a good place to casual dine in.
author: Nikki P.

description: Ate here for today's lunch with colleague. It was delicious. I would love to come back again. The atmosphere made me feel like I was in China. Loved the fact that all the plates were different sizes, colors and shapes. 3 dishes were not enough to give a full rating! We had shrimp and mushroom, beef and bok choy, and chicken with yam. I don't know the real name of the entree since the owner (Peter) just created them for us. Going back ASAP!
author: Jihee K.

description: Went to this spot a while back so I can't remember everything I got but I do remember everything to be orgasmic. I left the establishment with a very happy stomach. If you're in the city you must stop by! Better than santung! Try the flower tea. It is very cool.
author: Nathan K.

description:
The staff is fast and do not like you to be slow.  I was too slow the first time here and they just surprised me with food.  But all was good because it was delicious.

Do not miss:
Sweet potatoes.
Calamari.  Trust me.  GET THIS.
author: Justin H.

description: House Noodles are super! Surprisingly good Goji Berry Tea~ what a treat. Wish I had asked for the Chef's Special and just let them bring me something incredible. Instead, settled for whatever was standard on the menu. Will know better next time as i'll definitely return!
author: Yasmin V.

description:
One of my favorite Chinese places to eat at in SF! 

I came here with my friend, and we ordered the sesame chicken dish. I think just about every table at the restaurant had that sesame chicken dish at their table. It was very good---they also had yams in the dish! Too bad I'm not really a fan of the sweet/fried chicken thing.
author: Jeanette S.

description:
WTF? How is there a line out the door at this place? It is nothing special, in fact there are several places better just with in a few blocks. 

Where do I begin-
The bus boys here run around all disorganized, stressed out, and clueless, wiping down tables with a filthy rag. 

The menu blows! poor selection.

The one shining moment is the green onion cake- best I ever had.

We also had some kind of chicken rice soup, which had zero flavor.  Reminded me of cream of wheat. This place just reminded me of how lucky we are in SF of decent Chinese like Brandy Ho's and Hunan Home.  This place is clearly for tourists who are used to eating at panda express. 

1 star if it wasn't for the onion cake...
author: Jim B.

description: We love this place. The waiters always help us order and haven't disappointed. Try the garlic beef- very yummy. My husband loves the seasonal greens as well. This place is delicious, affordable, and quick.
author: Amanda T.

description:
What I Ate
- pork dumplings with peanut sauce
- green onion pancakes with peanut sauce
- dumpling soup
- garlic fish
- sesame chicken and sweet potatoes 
- house noodles

Would I Go Again
I've been to House of Nanking three times, so...yes.  The pork dumplings with peanut sauce are my favorite, but I have liked almost everything I've tried here (the green onion pancakes were too heavy on the onions and too light on the pancakes).  The restaurant is pretty touristy, but the owner and staff all speak Cantonese and they will speak it with you if you speak it to them first.  Overall, I've never left disappointed with the food or restaurant experience.
author: Ben M.

description: The best place I have ever eaten! When it comes to Chinese food. This has been my first time back in about 5 years and it's still great. You cannot go wrong with anything you order and they have something for everyone from vegetarians to meat lovers. The dishes are authentic and worth every bite. I've been to NanKing almost everyday on my vacation.....
author: James J.

description:
have not been here for some time, and what a change.. had wonton soup... small bowl filled with sizzing tasteless rice and two wonton..  soup was inedible and wanton were decent.
then ordered pot stickers which were delicious but floating in an inedible overly peanut sweet sauce, and I could not taste the wonton.
the third item was sesame chicken and this arrived with the other two.. sent it back and when ready for our  main dish, same plate was served not even rewarmed.   Chicken was done well but floating in an overly sweet sauce which also was inedible.

end result a $32 bill for an inedible disgusting lunch..  If this is what you are looking for, this is the perfect place for you to go
author: ira l.

description:
My friend who "deflowered" my House of Nanking virginity was surprised I, an SF native and Chinese American, have never been here.  But that's the thing: "real Chinese people" don't go to House of Nanking.  The most Chinese thing about this place is the shitty service.  After you're greeted and seated, they've exhausted their smile quota, and can no longer tolerate being patient or friendly whatsoever.  If you hesitate even for a second to order or ask a question, they will have sprinted away, visibly and sometimes audibly frustrated you've wasted their time by being indecisive.  Normally, I wouldn't be so bothered by this, but I don't like paying "white people prices" for "Chinese service."

Sizzling rice soup - unlike any sizzling rice soup I've ever seen, but it had a lot of vegetables in it, so that was good.  And the lemon (ONE slice - stingy much?) made all the difference.  I hear they sometimes put sweet potato in it.  Not this time I guess.

Vege ABC - no longer on the menu, but they still make it if you order it.  It has eggplant, tofu, and mushrooms.  They didn't skimp on the eggplant at all - the pieces were huge.  The tofu tasted fresh and had a nice medium texture - not silken, but not firm-and-fried-dry either.  The stuffed mushrooms were SO good.

The braised green beans were braised green beans.  Nothing special, just more expensive than what you can find anywhere else.

The blossoming flower tea was fun to watch and came in a generously filled mug, but it wasn't very strong, and I think they sweetened it (just a note in case you want/expect it unsweetened).

I probably wouldn't come back on my own volition, but my vegetarian friend thinks it's glorious, so I'm glad I got to try a place that so pleases his palette.
author: Jenn C.

description:
The worst and most expensive fried rice ($15) I have ever had in a Chinese restaurant.  I should have trusted my instincts when it took 15 minutes to get a glass of cold water brought to the table--and left.   

I had the shrimp with barbecue pork and scallop fried rice, thinking that at $14 it was going to be pretty good.  Lots of fried egg, oily, salty, some green peas tossed in.

Years ago there was a wonderful restaurant here.  I wonder if the current owners have simply left all the accolades and prizes for the original business on its walls.

The name of the restaurant probably was not changed either; hence, the 1,350 reviews.

Actually I've made better fried rice at home by throwing together leftover meat and rice with a couple of eggs.

I ate the fried rice in ten minutes and then scrambled to get out of the place.  Another 10-15 minutes waiting to get the bill.
author: Lily H.

description: KATHY F. Thank you for replying to my comment. My example for unfriendly staffwas directed to the young man that served us. When I asked a question about a selection on the menu he acted like he was totally inconvenienced and didn't have time for our question and would not even look us in the eye or even at us he just looked away like "hurry the hell up"and another lady hovered over us while we paid bill and when I asked for a glass of wine he just walked away and just had a shitty attitude made us feel like "we are lucky to be here"my advice is just tell the employees to not look so hateful and miserable to serve the public.
author: Bonnie B.

description: An experience for sure. We got there for a late lunch. Our server came right over to get our drink order. We ordered the sizzling rice soup which we were told was medium spicy in reality it was mild. We ordered the towering scallops, sesame chicken, bao  beef wrap and calamari. The flavor on the chicken was perfect. I would have liked more. I would prefer it spicy but it was good. I thought scallop tower could have had more scallops. It only had three. I actually got nothing to eat off the plate but those that did sId it was really good. I did get a chance to taste the sauce which was tasty. The calamari if eaten right away is great but after it soaks in the lemon it turns soggy and mushy. The bao beef wrap was not a flavor I enjoyed. Overall the food good but our waiter was not very friendly.
author: TD S.

description: Must go if you are in the area. If you tell the waiter to give you whatever they want they will, just tell them the selected meats you like. They will bring out their top dishes and everything is absolutely divine.
author: Alexys C.

description:
Awesome hole in the wall Chinese restaurant! Iive in So. Cal and visit SF about 4 times a year! House of Nanking is a must during each trip! I usually get...
Sesame Chicken comes with sweet potatoes
Salt and Pepper Shrimp comes with delicious mushrooms
House Noodles can't explain the deliciousness that this is
Sweet and Sour soup is so good! It's what I imagine a Chinese grandma would make. Aside from the great spicy broth it has peas and zucchinis (which usually never comes in any hot and sour soup I eat back at home) and the usual ingredients. This is a must try if you like hot and sour soup

The service is not the greatest but the food is what I'm there for and what brings me back.
author: Jasmine M.

description: The food was really good but there is an issue with space. There are times when you have to wait outside until a spot opens up inside.
author: Eric C.

description:
(See pic)

Have eaten here a couple times. Always greased up just okay food. Fast service but come here only when you want to gain some weight. Simple dishes and taste like really cheap Chinese food. I guess that's a way and the place could also be called "Taste of local hole-in-the-wall cheap quality food." It's not particularly cheap, however.

People need to qualify this is not Hong Kong food, this is cheap quality food. And I still wonder why there's a line.
author: T L.

description:
Don't do it!  Here's why:
1. The sesame chicken was so overly salty that I couldn't even finish my second bite.  I wasn't the only one, most of the 6 of us left full plates of food behind)
2. The waitress was wearing latex gloves and touching everything with them including picking her nose (so often that we snapped a picture of her doing it), the wall, dirty dishes, and then the rim of my water glass.
3.  I didn't get a refill of water the whole time we were there until I finally grabbed her and asked (but after she grabbed it by the top, I wasn't thirsty anymore).
4.  Our waitress messed up our check and proceeded to explain how we were wrong, so we just paid and left.
Next time, we'll try Chef Jia next door instead.
author: Aris M.

description:
Tiny cozy restaurant with great food.  6 of us came in and ordered 'family style', basically they bring you a wide variety of dishes for everyone to sample.  The sesame chicken was their self proclaimed best dish and I dreamed about it for a week!  The soup was excellent, steamed pork dumplings were also very popular as were the fish entree and the beef.  All in all, we all left very satisfied for a low cost.

Great value, great food, interesting encironment.
author: Mark K.

description: Family style restaurant located in Chinatown, convenient less than one mile walk from Union Square. Food was delicious, portions generous, I especially enjoyed the tea. The restaurant offers vegetarian options. Service was prompt. Recommend.
author: Susan V.

description:
I've always wanted to try this place, and after years of being told it wasn't that great, i finally got to try it for myself and I was pleasantly surprised! Every dish we tried was delicious! My co-worker, who had been there several times, decided to tell the waitress the two dishes we absolutely wanted and to let her pick the rest of the menu. I highly recommend letting the server set your menu. It was a delectable feast of a variety of proteins in tasty sauces. 

We had:
fried potstickers
beef in honey sauce
stuffed mushrooms with pork
sesame chicken
crispy sole in garlic sauce

I liked all the dishes but I think my favorites were the sole in garlic sauce and the beef in honey sauce. Something about the fat in the beef merges nicely with the richness of the sauce. The dishes at the House of Nanking are by no means traditional, but they are tasty reinterpretations. Oh and don't let the line outside deter you. The food is totally worth the wait.
author: Dani D.

description:
When you're the only Asian in a Chinese restaurant IN CHINATOWN, that usually means trouble.  I'm sad to give this place a 2-star rating because I was kind of excited to try this place out due to it being mentioned on Bourdain's show (Layover).  In hindsight, I probably should have chose Mission Chinese, but House of Nanking was a more convenient foray.

The house chicken was forgettable.  It was a mouthful of sodium with every bite.  For every mouthful of chicken, I had two mouthfuls of rice.  

We also tried the Onioncakes.

-get that if you like onion.  I like onion so I liked this dish.  You will like it too if you like onion.

Service is gruff, very NYC, so I liked it.  Others warned of it, but I'm quite comfortable with it.  The restroom is definitely NYC-grade.

Too bad the food wasn't...
author: Nino R.

description:
A must go to spot for tourists and anyone who loves welcoming service and great authentic Chinese food!  Always a line to get in and very cramped, but the line goes quick and the crampedness adds to the whole experience.  Nan King himself comes and asks how your food is too!  Such amazing flavor here!  Different types of dishes than what u would usually NOT see in most Chinese menus.  On a main street and at the tip of China town!  I love this place. I'm from NJ and I try to make it here everytime i'm in SF! There's so much good Chinese in SF of course.. but this place is just different.

This is probably one of SF's most famous Chinese spots you have to go to! 
Famous! Delicious! Try the Eggplant!
author: Anuj P.

description: love. haven't been in years but was one of my favorites when I lived in north beach.
author: Julia E.

description: This is a message for management - guys, pls update your hours of operation on yelp. It currently says that you are open from 11am to 10pm. So we got here at 2pm for lunch, but were informed that it was closed. Now under normal circumstances this wouldn't bother me as much, but we were visiting from LA and decided to make a special trip to your restaurant because we heard good things. We mentioned this to the older gentleman but he didn't seem to care much. Instead, he curtly escorted us out and locked the door from inside. I was hoping he would make an exception for us because we weren't local. Besides, the restaurant was still serving food to other customers when we arrived.
author: Zee R.

description:
This is so funny. I live in the city for so many years, but never heard of this place. What's up with that? Okay, my elementary school friend and her hubby visited me from New York City las winter. And one of places they asked me to take them to is House of Nanking. 

We heard you'd have to wait for so long in line to get the table, so we got there super early in the monring. And BANG, they were not opened. :( We had to come back again the next day (becasue my friend's hubby wanted to try their food so bad) and it was worth of going. I would strong recommend for eggplant dishes! Best eggplant I've ever treid. All the other eggplants I had with Chinese restarant is really greasy. And the sesame chicken is like the heaven. So yummmm.
author: Sam W.

description:
House of Nanking offers a quality of food that could easily be found at a much more expensive restaurant.  The one star reviews of this place are absolutely criminal.  I saw the 3.5 overall rating and thought it must have gone downhill, but nothing could be further from the truth.  My family just had dinner there and everyone agreed it was some of the best Chinese food they'd ever had.  The dishes and style are unique, so don't expect the old standbys.  But be assured, just about anything you order will be delicious.  There's always a line out the door, and that means a lot more than the confused complainers here on Yelp.

My favorite was the scallop towers (scallop on lemon slice on eggplant) - unusual and surprisingly delicious.  The Nanking chicken is similar to Orange Chicken, but the addition of friend sweet potato chips adds a special twist.  The tofu was delicious - chewy skin and creamy inside.  The fried rice had a yummy moistness to it and was jam packed.  I'll be making it back as soon as I'm in the neighborhood again.  The wait was worth it.
author: Aneil M.

description:
This place is pathetic.  $42 for a bowl of rice (stale), two "entree's" that were absolutely disgusting, and a re-sent out order of pork fried rolls.

1. I asked for lemonade which they market on their menu.  They didn't have it so plopped a sprite in front of my face as if I didn't have a choice in the matter.

2. Ordered pork fried rolls, they came cold and dry.  Disgusting.  

3. I ordered garlic chicken (wasn't on the menu but they said they could do it).. It ended up being trace amounts of what some may call chicken (mostly fat) and it had big slices of ginger with other ingredients I couldn't decipher.  My friend ordered some other dish and seemed to be ok with it.

4. When we tried to pay and split the outrageous $20/person meal (AT LUNCH) with our debit cards, this lady came up to us and basically yelled "you either pay cash or one card" and walked away as if we were children being told not to yell inside and had been warned before.  MY GOD.  

I'm pregnant and they're lucky I didn't puke all over their floor or rip their heads off from raging hormones.  

Get it together House of Cold & Overpriced Food.
author: Megan D.

description: The food was quite good but the service was the worst, it was very unpleasant. On top of it, the waitress wrote her own tip in my card receit, instead of letting me choose how much I wanted to tip. Incredible.
author: Marcos G.

description:
I too was pointed to this restaurant when a friend visited me after I first moved to SF.  She asked her hotel for recommendations as she was craving good Chinese food.  So we trudged off to find this place.  Had to wait a few outside on the sidewalk for a table, nearly retching from the stench emanating from the street (it was foul).  However, once we got inside we had fun.  First, don't expect anything fancy.  It's an absolute hole-in-the-wall. You will sit elbow to elbow with strangers at long cafeteria style tables.  Hey, it's a chance to chat up your neighbors. 

They are busy at Nanking most of the time so they don't mess around.  They'll slap the drinks down and split before you can open your mouth even to thank them or ask for anything else, literally.  They don't do it out of meanness or inattention.  They are usually just really swamped.  If you are a person who needs to be fawned over and chatted up by your server, don't come here.  Take their tea and shut up.  Figure out what you want to order and know they are happy to take special requests as well.  Order several plates, share, enjoy.  Their portions are generous.  That's the fun of Nanking.  You want fancy, go to Perbacco and overpay.  The server there will fawn all over you while they take your money. 

I have taken several people to Nanking since and we have always enjoyed it and they have asked to go back on additional visits.  Yeah, we've had to wait sometimes for what seemed like forever to get the server's attention.  Not a big deal.  If you have a show to catch, say something ahead of time.  I've always enjoyed their food.  I almost always order the same thing (chicken, black bean sauce, vegetables, spicy please).  My guests are more adventurous but have always said they enjoyed their food.  Don't want greasy, fried...say so and you'll get something more tailored to your tastes.  I had not written a review yet--I don't know why, but I'm reading so many complainers here today, I just felt I had to put in my two cents.  I don't understand why people feel EVERY restaurant should be white table clothes and 5-star service.  Sometimes it's just about he experience.  Chill out and live a little. I'll get off my soap box now. 

Anyway, I write this knowing I am going again for lunch with my Aunt (she likes Nanking and is asking to go back--and she's in her 80s!) and so I will come back and add to this review very specifically about our dishes that we order today.    So many people raved about the sizzling soup I am convinced I have to try it.  Standby for more....
author: Kelly T.

description: I'd describe it as one of those hole in the wall places that seem to never disappoint. The melts in your mouth calamari, melts in your mouth. Overall great place, just don't go there for the booze selection...one beer choice and a box of wine are your option
author: Patrick G.

description:
For those of you complaining there's no good chinese food in the city, shut the front door! This is a revelation!! Some of the best chinese food I've ever had! The beef & green beans is better than my mom could make. They flash fry the beef and the spices are so well balanced and savory and the whole thing drips with the fatty delicious... I'm losing words.

The fish soup is transcendent. It's not a traditional soup but creamy with a wonton and enough noodles to keep it interesting. There are layers of flavor with the greens and the fish! I think it's a sea bass but how do they keep the skin crispy while it's still in the soup? It's a delicious mystery.

And go with a chinese person. You poor people coming in ordering chow mein have no idea what you're missing. The chinese menu is smaller, but has items that just don't make it to the english side. And yes, we did get treated better and comped our flower teas because we spoke chinese. But 5 stars even without the special treatment.

Definitely order Crispy honey beef & fish soup

Waiters and owners hurry you up and basically rush to get you in and out. Basically lending to it's authenticity.
author: Daniel C.

description:
Slow service, sizzling rice soup was bomb, rest ok to low quality. I tried to order several dishes and the waiter, a silver haired guy with a skin bushy flattop haircut told me it was too much. So after my family ate it all and was still hungry, I told him I wanted to order the rest. He gave attitude and this took another 20+ minutes. At the end we still were shorted a soup. In addition they only give you a very limited menu unless you ask for a full one which we saw ppl do after we were almost done with our second order. So basically 20+ extra minutes were added to our visit. It seemed that they were only interested in turnover. If I owned a restaurant and someone wanted to order extra, I would be sure to let them. Not only a higher ticket, but maybe they travelled over 300 miles and a friend told them to go there and they wanted leftovers???? I was very disappointed although I still tipped 20% where I would have given more. I will probably never be back as on all side there is competition who is happy to have customers who like to order a lot of food!!!

So it was 12 noon last Wednesday, the man in the photo with you was our main waiter, must be the owner, oh well.
author: Jon E.

description: The food here was good but the service was really bad. Maybe it was just busy that day but seriously the guy did not deserve a tip after waiting for a table we were rushed to order and it was so hard to communicate with the waiter we were so hungry so we just ate and left. we didn't get the chance to enjoy the food. Not going here again.
author: Jill C.

description: I love this place! My first time in San Francisco and I stumbled upon this gem.  We had no wait at all, and the food came out so quickly.  I thought that the food may not be so great since it had come out right away but I was wrong. The food was amazing!  I'm glad there was no line when we went or I may never have found out what a great place this is.
author: j s.

description:
After this place was recommended by THREE people, we had to find it. 

Food: 
Try ANY of the soups! Also, the dumplings were plentiful and they were surrounded in a nice sweet but not too sweet sauce that was a mix between soy, berries, and syrup and sesame. It sounds strange, but it was awesome. The sesame chicken wasn't too salty at all and it was accompanied by the best sweet potato slices I think I've ever had. The pork stuffed mushrooms were something I've never had before and I would highly suggest them. There were about 20 of them in one dish and the locals next to us kindly offered some to us after they saw us drooling :)
A lot of the food was perfectly seasoned and didn't leave you sick, which is so refreshing! 

Their menu is small, but you'll find what you want on it.

They also have SUPER cheap house wine... $3.95 a glass. They fill it to the brim, but I'm pretty sure it's watered down since I didn't have red stains on my lips, when usually they are beaming bright purple after a glass of the good stuff :) Still, can't complain!


Service: 
Their service is a little wonky, and I think some locals got better service than we did, but the food was still awesome.
author: Susan F.

description:
I cannot imagine anyone who is actually Asian liking this place.   This is hands down the worst Asian food I've ever had.   There is a single brown sauce that goes on everything, and it is extremely salty. 

I imagine they make their living by selling to European tourists.
author: Jonathan D.

description: This review is purely based on service as the unacceptable waitress/owner left a terrible taste on us which ultimately ruined our appetite. As an Asian wife to a Caucasian husband, I did not expect a drop of racism when ordering. Upon being seated, the waitress provided us the menu and without even giving a single second for us to look at the menu, the waitress rudely said "oh you're white, okay you will order the chicken". Without giving us an opportunity to say "no thank you", the waitress swiftly left as quickly as she rushed our order. I understand that the chicken is their most popular order and that the waitress simply wanted to recommend their signature dish, however should my husband be allergic to sesame or any other ingredients in the dish, the consequence would be more severe than a simple loss of autonomy. When "our" order came up, the chicken could've been prepared by a 3 Michelin star chef, but it was drenched in what felt like pure rudeness! Of course, we could've spoke up louder about our order, but it felt like we werent given a chance. Ultimately, a warning to all- the service feels quite rushed. Perhaps the food is good, but I guess I will never be able to fully appreciate this place after our horrible experience.
author: Alice L.

description: If this was anywhere else except SF, NYC, or LA Chinatowns, I can understand the hype.  To the Chinese food connoisseur, the food was OK, but overpriced in my opinion compared to other fabulous places in Sunset or inner Richmond.  I should have known better when I saw that the number of non-Chinese customers out numbered Chinese customers.  Not that there is anything wrong with it.  As for food, we had the pot stickers, bao bing wrap, and melt in your mouth calamari.  The calamari wasn't exactly melt in your mouth and the pot stickers were sub par.  The bao bing wrap was akin to a burrito and was the tastiest of the bunch. It reminded me of the Thai food I had for lunch at King of Thai in inner Richmond due to the Thai basil in it.  If sesame chicken is your idea of Chinese food, this is a place for you.
author: Chiang K.

description:
Best Chinese food in all of San Francisco. Service is very European. When they come to your table you better know what you want or they will order for you. When you're done eating and the restaurant is busy you will need to pay and leave, or else....

Some advice for eating here:

1. Please know what you want to order almost immediately,  or else.

2. If its busy and you are done eating, you need to pay and leave, or else.

3. You will have to share a table with another couple unless you have a large party.  This is great because it allows you to meet other people and mingle.

4. Please do not insult the chef by asking for soy sauce or anything else that would offend.   If you do something stupid like,  ask for soy sauce with your rice,  it will be slammed down on the table in front of you.  

5. If you order flower tea and they don't have any... They will bring something else substituted.   I hope you like it.   Just like when waiter shows up for the first time and you're not ready to order. He will order for you.  

6. If multiple people in your party order the same thing, they might bring you something else to mix up dinner.

7. Sometimes there's a line.  It's totally worth waiting. Even if it's pouring in the rain, it's worth it.

8. This restaurant can appear to have some of the rudest people serving you but have you seen service in Europe?   Exactly.

9. If you need to find a place to park, good luck, I hope you took public transportation.

Summary:
If you're in San Francisco and you want Chinese food head to Chinatown.  I'm glad I did.
author: Bob R.

description: They have a heavy hand of MSG here, which made me sick. Again caution folks, overwhelming amount of MSG in their dishes!! It's too bad because the food was tasty going down. Indeed as most other reviews, the service here is terrible. Being rude to their customers must be a job requirement.
author: Esther K.

description:
While a lot of people seem to be knocking House of Nanking for not being authentic, maybe they're just having those type of expectations due to this being so centralized to the heart of the Chinatown area.  I went here for a quick business lunch and all the dishes we tried, about 5 in all, were pretty solid.  They did have this amazing tea with a flower inside that "opened" up as it soaked up the hot water in a big glass that almost resembled a beer mug.  

One thing that I did not take a liking to is how pushy and rushy they were during lunchtime.  We had a group of about 7 people and about 5 happened to be Chinese.  The waitress kind of just assumed all the Chinese people understood Chinese and settled to "negotiate" the lineup of entrees with the guy that looked like he'd most like be from Hong Kong or something.  Therefore, she just disregarded whatever we thought we wanted and said "I'll just bring you some dishes."  Thank goodness it was on company budget because I've never seen this happen before and I'd be steaming mad if she happened to bring me dishes out of my price range.
author: Albie F.

description:
Came here after my workout! 
1. The food here was pretty tasty
2. Customer services was so so
3. Charge us x3 times more than we ate :( good that we caught it and have it reverse!
author: Charlie H.

description:
I've been coming here for the last 15 years whenever I come to San Francisco. Brought my family here with me today. The owner of this spot asked if it was anybody's first time and since 4/5 of us had never been there before the owner said he'd take care of us and that we need not order.

First came a giant mushroom with the most delicious broth. The mushroom was tender and juicy and boy that broth great. 

Then veggie pot stickers that were filled with wonderful crisp veggies and drizzled in peanut and sweet and sour. 

Next was crispy beef. Oh man the beef was so very very tasty and tender and the bok choy that came with it was to die for. Seriously I can't get over how good this dish was. 

Next up was eggplant with tofu. Normally I'm not a big eggplant fan but this eggplant wasn't mealy like most I've had and the sauce that was covered in was yummy. 

Finally was honey shrimp with nashi pears. Loved it! The pears were such a great surprise. 

I've always loved this place but it was a real treat this time and my family was very impressed as well. Thanks so much!!
author: Shane S.

description:
I absoltely love this place! i'm vietnamese/chinese and i know exactly what chinese food is suppose to taste like, and if the restaurants are catered to chinese people or AMERICAN people and I can tell you it's definitly catered to my fellow American friends.

That doesnt necessarily mean its a bad thing! 

You MUST try:

1. The Sesame Chicken which is served with this syrupy sweetness sauce with sweet potatoes, SCRUMSCIOUS.

2. The Crackling Beef,  the pieces of i think its toasted ricecakes really adds a nice texture.

3. try the blossom tea, its really good and very pleasing to look at.

it's a bit pricey but well worth it. this place gets pretty packed for dinner  so arrive early and it's a bit crampy inside, but aren't most good restaurant a hole in the wall anyways?
author: Tam T.

description:
Try the shaking beef w/ baby bok choy. you wont be disappointed.

food is excellent and service was good.
author: Dan L.

description:
My favorite Chinese food spot in Chinatown -- House of Nanking!  Totally legit.  This place has been here a long time and so have the waitstaff.  They have seen it all and are nonplussed by the whole thing.  Yes, they are a little irascible but the food is totally worth it.  

You have to be a little bossy and know what you want and you'll be just fine.  OR, just ask for Mr. Fang (when he's there) and ask him to bring you what he thinks is good -- just give him parameters "two meat dishes and one seafood" or "all veggies" and he'll take care of you!  

The Sesame Chicken is chinese comfort food at its finest but the real knock out that most people don't even know about is the Sizzling Rice Soup -- wow!  It's surprisingly lemony and delicious.  Don't overlook this gem.  

Good luck!
author: Anthony V.

description: Chose this restaurant because of Yelp reviews and Lonely Planet recommendation. I have no idea why.  It is a good thing we did not have to wait to be seated because my disappointment would have overwhelmed me.  Ordered pot stickers, which were barely warm.  The thought of the ones I buy from Costco came to my mind while I was eating.  I do not think there would be much difference, except maybe mine would have been hotter.  My husband had fried rice-nothing special.  The service was as described in the other reviews, but we did not care about that.  Maybe we ordered the wrong items?   I just don't get it the hype!
author: Jeanine M.

description: We wandered in while walking around Chinatown. So happy we did. The food was exceptional especially for the price and they were really quick. Wishing we had a place like this in Sacramento. Guess we'll have to come back and visit more often!! The sesame chicken, chow mein, fried rice and steamed pork dumplings were so fresh. Yummy!
author: Anna E.

description:
So it's just okay.  I guess there is a lot of buzz about this place, but I don't really see why.  Is it good?  ehhhh it's okay.  My pallet for Chinese food is a little biased but I don't see much from this place.  I came here with some co-workers and bosses.  People seem to like it but the flavors lack depth.  There isn't much to the food.  If it is supposed to be sweet, it is sweet from sugar.  

We got the Nanking chicken because it is apparently the house special.  It was okay, but again, it wasn't special or anything. 

We also got some noodles.  I don't 100% remember the type, but I believe it was the noodles with beef.  It was okay, but again, something I could probably get anywhere else for much cheaper.   

In the end, I probably wouldn't choose to come here again if I didn't have to.
author: Best T.

description:
House Of Nanking... My mouth waters just thinking of it. Being all the way down in LA, I only get to the area of Kearny & Jackson a few times a year now. But I'll eat there at least twice in one visiting weekend easily. This place was for many years considered the "Best CHEAP chinese restaurant in the COUNTRY"... Love this place. NEVER disappoints.
I always order the Tsingtao chicken, Nanking beef, the DELISH shrimp/onion cake & stuffed mushrooms... Tell Peter, the owner, that it's your 1st time there and he may take away your menus and order items for you that are NOT on there... He usually orders up some real good soup for us. Like I said, NEVER disappoints...
Some advice: To avoid waiting in a crazy long line and feeling rushed.  Go before lunch, mid-afternoon or before the dinner rush. It's not that hard... It's worth it. ENJOY... I'm already counting the days...
author: Chuck D.

description: We were looking for a place to eat at Chinatown and this place appears to be the top 1 place having to try. We got lucky and were seated quickly. Not sure I like some of the dishes we tried which were highly recommended by the waitress. It was an adventure experience. Not a typical Chinese or American food .. Worth to try ..
author: Tracy D.

description:
Pretty Darn awesome.  Boss took me here and tried the Fish over the dry noodles, and some kung-pao chicken.  The tea (not sure if they still have this) was really a nice touch as it comes out in a big stein mug with a bulb on the bottom that opens up into a flower, make sure you get that!  

Heard that the owner is really cool and he'll ask you what kind of dish you want (i.e. beef, fish, etc.) and he'll get you something.  I like that service, got's style.

The only gripe I would have is that it's pretty cramped inside, so if you have another person with you, you might need to sit next to some other folks and share the table.
author: Dennis K.

description:
This was the best Chinese food I have ever eaten. The wonton soup is completely out-of-this world! I would come back just for that. The orange chicken was epic too. I'm giving 4 stars versus 5 because the dining experience was more like 2 stars, however I was told that this would be the case. We felt like the servers would pretend like they didn't hear us, even though we were speaking clearly and loudly. The servers would walk away when they were ready and we would practically shout (nicely) if we wanted something else! 
Bottom line: this food is worth going far out of your way for. The servers have a slight sense of entitlement, and the place is ridiculously crowded at all times. However, I will definitely go back just for the food.
author: Aaron L.

description:
I stopped in early (5:15pm ish) for dinner. This place is tiny.  Service was very efficient. I told the waitress I wanted the chef special. She said what meat do you want? Chicken, beef, fish?  I said what is fresh. She said, you like fish. I said yes. Garlic Fish, she said. I also ordered the blossoming tea. 

Wow!  The fish was perfectly cooked, subtle in flavor and absolutely delicious. The blossoming tea was excellent and fun to watch the transformation.  I can't wait to come back and try some more specials.  

Thank you!
author: Paul P.

description: My review is a little late since we went here a couple of times in the past and forgot to post on Yelp. My husband and I had date night dinners here, and we also brought his brother and sister-in-law when they were visiting from Hawaii. Every time we went here and every dish we ordered was very very good. Not sure what the bad reviews are about, but I definitely had a nice experience here. I give them five stars for the food, but the place is a little small unfortunately and there is not much space to move. But we always like coming back here. It's a little on the pricy side though plus parking is difficult to find since it's by Chinatown.
author: Cindy S.

description:
We came here with local friends that live in Silicon Valley and were told "You have to try this."

Fun Facts:
Its in China Town.
Parking sucks (but its worth it so just do it) its on the street on in a parking garage 1/2 mile away.
There is a line and you have to stand outside (no benches), we did it with a 1 year old...still, worth it.
They do not have highchairs. This was difficult to deal with but again, food and service were enough to still 5 star this place.

Our local friends have had 2 types of experiences here. 

The 1st type is when its busy: you go in your order and you get what you ordered. This is the experience we had, we had the calamari, onion cakes, lemon chicken and a few other dishes I don't remember well. What stood out was the onion cakes. I could have eaten a table full, and I dislike onions. I have searched high and low in Phoenix and still cannot find anyone who serves these. I must go back.

The 2nd type of experience much like Tyler W. described is when the owner is available to take your order. Our friends described walking in and letting them know it was their first time and the owner politely took their menus and made course after course of amazing food. 

I can only imagine the owner thinks, "Oh no...I got this!"
It is an amazing place, they were attentive and the food was great. When we make it back out there, this is my 1st stop!
author: Trish S.

description: Had some lunch in Chinatown at this spot. Service is not as good as you want it to be, took them a little while to get our order, and the server walked away before asking if we wanted drinks. When the food arrived it was pretty good. The sesame chicken is what I would strongly recommend. If ever back in Chinatown I doubt I would go here again but try something else instead
author: Alex R.

description:
OMG!!...can you say MSG headache & food drenched in starchy sauce? Every time we walk by this place, there happened to be people waiting outside. So couple days ago, the bf & I walked by and there was no wait - so fine let's go in & refresh my memory was "Nan King" food is.

The moment I we sat down, I was already questioning what kind of "culinary" dish we're going to be presented by, because, I scanned the room & we're the only Asian customer - I started to get nervous. (Does this place appeal to people who like P.F.Changs?) Well, I should have trusted my intuition: majority of the food was emphasized with sweet & salty sauce. Got the popular sesame chicken - average, salty & full of msg sauce. Then the mushu beef was tender, but again, saturated in thick soy sauce.  Thank goddess the large cup of tea of $3 was beer jug size to wash down all the salt. So I will not return. Come at your own risk if you chose not to believe the poor yelp reviews & be fooled by the 4-star rating.
author: Yum Y U M.

description:
Been hearing about the House of Nanking from NYC friends who've visited San Francisco and keep telling me "It's the place to go for great Chinese food in the bay area". So decided to make an evening of it while out in SF this time out.

Wow... Um really? All that comes to mind is "Meh..." with a side of "Lame..."

The House of Nanking food is a small notch above average, not terrible just "OK".

Honestly that's it! 

Yeah it's got a dark funky Irish pub meets Chinese takeout feel; maneuvering the cramp dinning area is like a fingure trap and the staff reminds me of NYC's DMV employees "In Jamica Queens" but none of this is really appetite intensive for the stomach. 

Sum it up - If you want to wait 30 minutes to 1 hour outside for notch above average 
thats a total trap for tourists, sit with collage students looking to hang before hitting Unions Square bars and patrons form years past trying to rekindle an old memories of  House of nanking form 15 years ago "Before the yelp fame got to its head" then go...

Would I do it  again on my own? Would be a hard sell... Rather go to R&G Lounge a few blocks away.
author: Crazy Ivan X.

description: So good. House noodles. Dumplings. Shrimp and mushrooms. I don't like leaving reviews, but we were in SF for 2 nights and ate here two times in a row! Awesome.
author: Kaelee P.

description: This is not authentic Chinese food! Barely a step above takeout. Came here from out of town, with high expectations for SF Chinese food. Greatly disappointed by the Americanized menu and overall lack of luster. Perhaps this place was good at some time, but it definitely was not noteworthy when I went. Avoid at all cost!
author: Jess C.

description:
I would give it less if I were to consider price... but at the House of Nanking, you have to go with OUT the thought of how much it will cost!  Yes, it's expensive... but with a place as "historical" as this, you just can't think cost.  Just look at the pictures on the wall of who has been there, that alone gives them the right to jack up their prices.  I know, doesn't seem fair, but that's life.

Ok, now back to the food, the REAL reason for this review!  It's simply the best.  Authentic?  Definately not!  But DELICIOUS!  Hands down my favorite joint in all of SF.  if I could eat here every week I would!  Sadly, a $75 lunch for two only occurs about twice a year at most!  Owner is always the one who serves us... could it be he remembers us?  He always knows what we want!  Sesame chicken, crispy rice, and garlic eggplant (if bf is not with us and it's me and the kids, we also include the garlic fish... I'm not a huge fish fan, but THIS one is YUMMO!!!)

House of Nanking, until we meet again!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Came here because we were told it was the place to go. Turned out to be just a bit too pricey for us, and did not seem all that special. 

First of all, the wait in line was crazy. The line wrapped around the building just to get in to the TINY restaurant. Waited for about 20-30 minutes. The place was packed. If you have more than four people, be prepared for a LONG wait. We watched one group of about 6 people wait for far longer than we had to wait...totally not a good place to bring a big group. Plus, you may have to share a table if you have three people. Not a chair goes to waste. You will get very friendly with your neighbors because the tables were so crammed together. 

Total was over $67 for three people. Yikes! However, I must say that the food was unique. I got the detoxifying fruit tea...it was quite amazing, and stood out from the rest of the food. It had crushed fruit at the bottom, which gave it a sweet flavor. Definitely worth the $2 or $3. 

The orange chicken was pretty good. Crispy and unique. Unfortunately, I don't quite remember everything we ordered, but it was all good. I noticed that the food seemed less greasy and more fresh than other Chinese restaurants I have been to. They altered the typical recipes to have more vegetables (and new vegetables that I had never seen with Chinese food before). Definitely was fresh and good. 

Overall, if you want a different twist on Chinese food, come here. If you do not like long, tiresome and stressful waits in line to get in, crowded and loud seating, frantic servers, and high priced food, do not come here.
author: Christie B.

description:
It's true what they say.  It's not authentic Chinese food.  But why complain about authenticity when the food is just good?  

It's also true that the waiter will create the order for you.  We sat down as a party of 6 and then we all stared at the menu.  Our waitress came by for our orders and asked, "First time here?  Ok, I make order for you.  Are you hungry?  Any vegetarians?"  Of our party, I don't eat meat, one doesn't eat seafood, and another doesn't eat pork.  The waitress took care of us and definitely didn't leave anyone hungry.  Usually as the vegetarian, I get gypped and only get one or two vegetarian friendly dishes.  The waitress brought us an appetizer for all of us to share, 3 vegetarian dishes and 3 meat dishes.

We got:
- Onion Cake: not quite like a scallion pancake like at authentic Chinese restaurants.  It was good, but the sweet soy sauce drizzled on top was a bit too salty
- Calamari: reported as some of my friends' favorite of the night
- Mushrooms: tasted kinda plain to me, but some of my friends really liked it
- Stir-fry Beef
- Shrimp and green beans
- Sesame Chicken with Sweet Potato: you know it's inauthentic already when they throw in a sweet potato.  but hey, it works so don't complain!
- Tofu in black bean sauce: the tofu was so good because it's crispy on the outside, soft and silky on the inside with a touch of sweetness from the sauce
- Pea shoots: refreshing because it was our only true vegetable dish that wasn't fried in a bunch of oil.

Service is horrible if you're not familiar with the popular chinese restaurant ways.  For a popular chinese restaurant, service is quick and to the point.  If you want something, you need to be aggressive.  Forget raising your hand... when any waiter walks by, you shove the empty rice pot in their face or ask for the bill or ask for change -- and they won't be offended.  

I'm glad the waitress created our order for us.  Otherwise, we probably wouldn't have known what to order and some of it probably wouldn't have been the best food.  Sometimes I feel like restaurants might do this to get out the more easily cooked foods to you... and it could be a little true, but they definitely would probably be bringing out a better selection than you can pick if you don't know what to get.
author: Tran T.

description:
You know, I heard this place was incredible and I couldn't understand why it didn't have a higher score on Yelp. 

Now I know. The food? Incredible. The service? Not so much.

I'm not going to give you a play by play here. Just the highlights.

We were repeatedly ignored and when she DID come to the table it was ONLY when I flagged her down and she hurried through and LITERALLY left WHILE I was talking. Half of those times, she had a mouth full of food, rolled her eyes and sent someone else. 

WOW.

Try the food. Don't stay long.
author: Robert M.

description: I taught English in Taiwan long ago and this place reminds me of restaurants there.  My family of three was seated, then another diner was seated next to us.  The place is small and popular, and seating is communal.  The food is amazing.  I make marinated mushrooms regularly, but after eating salt and pepper mushrooms at House of Nanking my home cooked will not suffice.  So good.  We also tried Tofu in black bean sauce and market greens.  Also eggplant.  That's a lot of food, but my son had only a small container of left-overs to take home.  We arrived at 6 pm and were seated without a wait, but there was a line waiting to be seated as we left.
author: Patricia R.

description:
I really appreciated receiving an immediate response from the manager at House of Nanking with a suggestion that I can customize my order the next time I come in. I was very impressed that someone from the restaurant read my review and responded.
----------
author: Jo H.

description: Delicious sesame chicken and beef wraps! Service isn't too friendly but food and prices were great!!!
author: Jackson M.

description:
Well... mid day and no line. But service is sketchy. They gave me a seat but no menu. They didn't take my order for at least 20 mins. The tables are communal here and they took the order of another person at my table before my order. No biggie I thought.she took mine immediately after---Uhhh, he got his food 10 minutes ago and I'm drafting a review. They also forgot his rice. I really hope this meal is awesome cuz I'm starved !

OK, food shows. The soup is very good --- not sure why they couldnt have brought it out first. And the scallop dish? Tasty. Thin sliced and nice greens too. Got out for just over $20. Service is sketchy. Food is pretty good. But it's tourist central, and there seems to be a thin-veiled contempt at the customers. Also, the hostess/owner was eating a bowl of vegetables, by hand, while alternately distributing menus. Yuck.
author: James S.

description: Amazing food.  Terrifying service.  Server was eating chicken wings the entire time she was serving us.  Used hands to sprinkle sesame seeds on all dishes and left chicken grease on our drinking straws.  We will not be dining here again just for those reasons.
author: James L.

description: Yummy yummy!!! Sesame chicken oh my! Service eh who needs service when the food is this good!!!
author: Castillo F.

description: Best Chinese food EVER!!! This place is amazing. Dumplings were great, noodles were amazing and the fish was melt in your mouth! Yummmmm!!!
author: Allison D.

description:
Upon the recommendation of a coworker who used to live in San Francisco, I ended up stopping by here for lunch when I visited the Bay Area earlier this year. It was just a block away from the hotel I was staying at, and it was a nice change of pace from driving around to eat. My girlfriend and I popped in around lunch hour, and we ended up sharing a table of six with other customers.

Although I was expecting pretty good Chinese food (based on my prior expectations and the other experiences I had at other Chinese restaurants), I wasn't blown away by the food. By far the best item we ordered on the menu was the bao bing wrap, which was amazingly delicious. The beef (I think? I can't recall of the top of my head) was very savory and tender, and the duck sauce and scallions were perfectly balanced. The waiter actually helps prepare a couple wraps for you to show you how it's done. The rest of the dishes weren't that memorable, though. The sesame chicken was perhaps slightly above average, but nothing memorable. The dumplings were a bit of a disappointment...deep frying the dumplings made for a flavorless outer skin, and the peanut sauce that was included clashed with the pork and herbs in the dumplings.

Service was typical for a Chinese restaurant - that is to say that it wasn't particularly attentive service, but they were more responsive and filled up my water more than others I've been to. The price was pretty reasonable, and I can see why it was pretty packed during a weekday at lunchtime. It's a nice place to stop in and have standard Chinese fare - better than your basic generic cuisine, but not a place that'd be on the top of my list to visit right off.
author: Asuka N.

description:
I treked all the way to get to this restaurant and got there are 1:30 PM and the morons were closed. Tell me how the F%^* you support a restaurant that posts a time on the door but closes in the middle of the time posted.

When you knock the door they don't even come to the door and explain why they are closed..... you need that basic courtesy or no matter what food you are cooking you do not deserve my pateronage/money.... F*&^ YOU!
author: H S.

description: Way too salty, and it seems to just get worse every time I come back. The crispy rice soup is about the best item. The flowering tea stein is great. Everything else, meh. Then again, I don't like particularly salty or american style Chinese.
author: Steve T.

description: Food was delish!!!! But beware, the service is a little....forceful. But the food is good, so it's worth it...
author: Michael R.

description:
Great atmosphere!!! Recommended by my native SF friends and boy were they right! Ya gotta wait in line for seating , it was out the door, but what better than to people watch in SF! 

Don't remember what we ate, it was labor day weekend 2012, but it was all really good!!! We were packed in the small place and they were pulling up cases of beer for people to sit on but it didn't matter because it was nice and loud and intimate and friendly and frantic and well worth it!

Can't wait to go back next time we're in SF!

Don't remember if they took credit cards....
author: Alonzo H.

description: Don't go with the Chinese menu. It's only going to confuse you. Just stick with their regular menu and get the Sesame chicken; it's the best on the menus. Also, go for the fried rice, they cook it with a house made hot sauce which is really good!
author: Noeman S.

description:
I have such mixed feelings about this place. The food is REALLY good but every time I go I am shocked by the service which is some of the worst I have ever experienced. 

Usually there are "floaties" in my water, when I ask for new water they bring me water that still has strange things floating in it. I have had to return silverware several times b/c it usually has hard and dried food on it. This last time my plate had crusted dried food on it. Also, this last time I went, it took 6 minutes to get water and when the server brought it to me he was holding my glass by the rim with one thumb actually in my water! When he handed me the water, the rim of the glass had grease lining it where I was supposed to put my mouth.

Another huge annoyance is sometimes they decide they don't want to bother taking our credit card and demand we pay in cash. The best way around this is tell them you don't have enough cash to leave a tip with and then their story changes and their credit card machine magically fixes it's self.

I don't know if I would recommend this place to anyone. I think the hype for this place is way better than the actual place itself.
author: Raychul M.

description: Loved to eat at Nanking while working in San Francisco.  Visited last Friday for lunch and it was terrible!  Very few menu offerings, terrible service and food that tasted as though it had been prepared days before and reheated.  Would have been better served at fast food Chinese at airport.
author: Dottie G.

description:
I've eaten here often since the 90's and I find that I reluctantly must now downgrade my opinion of HNK. The food used to be spectacular for the price but now it's just average. The sizzling rice soup was decidedly quiet and bland. The garlic fish was lacking garlic. The steamed pork dumplings saved the meal. 

Service was very slow but I confess we probably caught them at shift change. 

The real kicker was they forgot to bring the fried rice. I mentioned it to Peter (the owner) who simply shrugged citing the shift change Ten years ago, Peter would have personally solved the problem. Now, it's just my bad karma.

I'll go back only because I don't want to give up HNK but one more experience like this and that's it for me.
author: Tracy P.

description:
Yummmmmmmmmmmmmmm. I love this place.
Some one told me that eggplant is a distinctly womanly food, and damn if I ain't a woman. THE eggplant is out of CONTROL!!
I've been here a few times, and while its's the intensely flavored, salty, garlicy, hot food you always associate with Chinese food, its sooooo good. 
The crowd is exciting and there's really no way to not have a good time in the heart of Chinatown, across the way from City Lights.
I would give this place five stars, but it isn't a banquet (which is how Chinese food should be served), and the serving style is distinctly American. (minus one star) 

Eat here! It's a ton of fun and delicious!
author: Leah Q.

description:
Came from out of town. First time in San Francisco. Was so excited to be there and experience the city and the people. Read some awesome reviews on this place so thought we would give it a try. Not being from here we were having a hard time finding parking but hurried and found somewhere and hurried to the restaurant. When we got there we were waiting for a couple people who had just gotten up from their table to exit the building because it was so small in there. We went to go through the door to sit down and the old man came flying over and pushed us back out the door. Without saying a word like "I'm sorry we are closed" or anything he shook his finger at us and slammed the door on us. Leaving us standing looking in at the many people still seated inside. 

Then after looking at their website finding that they don't close until 930 and we had arrived at 5 to 9, I was even more disappointed. 

As I am a restaurant manager where I am from I was very unimpressed with the way that we were treated. Especially with knowing you are in a tourist city where a lot of people come to try the food and experience what you have, instead leaving with distaste for the place. 

I hope this review will help people not make the poor choice in going to this restaurant. Good food is not worth being treated like garbage!

It was a Friday night in a big city.... Hours said that they were open. Read other reviews that said the same thing happened to them. Just sayin....
author: Nicole S.

description:
Quick service. Reasonable prices. Friendly staff.

Had the sesame chicken, chow mein (with chicken added) and a tsingtao beer.

The chicken sesame was on-point. Came with a side of sweet potatoes. The chow mein was great, a little greasy, but I was a happy camper.

I'll def be back for lunch.
author: Barry B.

description: Family trip to San Francisco and I Google searched a place within china town. This is the first place that showed up. We decided to give it a try. Didn't wait that long for a table and food came out within minutes. Chow mein and chicken was good. Waiter was ok.
author: Luli M.

description: If I were visiting San Fran and was IN the area, I wouldn't mind dropping by this restaurant again.  It's decent.  Nothing out of the ordinary special but very decent in terms of flavors, price and portion.  We came during non busy hours so there was no wait time.  Again we were hungry from all the walking in the downtown San Fran area.  It's a place I'd order to go if I lived close to this restaurant.   They have good food, clean environment and quick service!
author: Christy L.

description:
My family and I have been coming here since I was a kid and now I always ask to eat here when I visit the Bay! The Sesame Chicken's amazing and is served with sweet potatoes. Definitely one of those food combinations that you don't normally think of putting together but ends being delicious! 

Expect a wait because the place is on the smaller side even after they took over the space next door but the food's definitely worth the wait.
author: Ely Anne V.

description:
Horrible overrated tourist trap with mediocre food, lousy service and hardly any Asian customers (take that as a hint). It really doesn't live up to the hype and the ridiculously long wait times. Trust me, go to Chef Jia's next door. There's never a wait, it's cheaper and the food is WAY better.

The main reason this place is full of 'tude is because their coffers are perpetually filled by the tourist dollars from visitors who want "local flavor"---and the truth is this place is about as authentic as a Disneyland "Main Street". They get away with the rude service and subpar food because day after day, tourists and hipsters line up around the block and it's galling because the food at Jia's next door is so much better. Please, don't follow the lemmings in Nanking and go to the most-empty restaurant a few doors down that's the REAL hidden gem. You won't be sorry.
author: Terry C.

description:
Hi Kathy,
   Your absolutely right there is no reason to name call , but it seems your more interested in that fact then my lousy dining experience.  What I didn't mention is I oqn a family restaurant in NJ myself. If my father or mother saw anyone treating customers so poorly I can garentee you , you wouldn't see them working in our restaurant ever again. Our restaurant is on the boardwalk on the New Jersey Shore so we deal with tourists every sindle day. We value that thry chose to spend hard earned money in our restaurant when their are so many other choices.  Saying your" as authentic as they come" that is not an excuse for any person , especially one paying you , to be as rudely treated as was my family.  No matter if your from China, San Francisco , New Jersey or wherever. Judging from many other reviews you might want to address the issue instead of making excuses. Again , I take nothing away from how excellent the food was, best Chinese Food I've ever eaten.
author: Amber H.

description:
We heard about this place from someone in a training session and it held up to all their recommendations. We arrived around 6:30 on a Thursday evening and were able to get a table quickly. It didn't take long for a line to form outside the door. We thought this was a good sign. 

The table next to us ordered a huge bowl of soup for 8. When we asked what it was, we were told it was fish soup and was not on the menu. We only had 3 people, but when we asked our server if we could order enough for 3 she said yes. 

The fish was excellent. It had a whole fish, wontons, and noodles. The flavor was perfect. We finished the bowl. 

Based on reviews from Yelp, we ordered the sesame chicken and the bao bing wraps. Both were so yummy. The fried rice was great and reminded me of the rice from my favorite Chinese place back home. 

The servers are not as friendly as you would hope. They want you to sit down, order quickly, eat and leave so that they can get more customers in the door. No one rushed us, but with the line at the door, you felt a little pressured. 

Overall, great food. I would recommend this place and would return for more great food.
author: Milea C.

description: Liked this place a lot! Nice interior and relaxed atmosphere. The service is horrible, but it is Chinatown after all. We had the calamari and sesame chicken. The calamari was nothing special but the chicken was amazing! Really really tasteful. Would absolutely visit again.
author: Viktoria B.

description:
The first time I came here (about a year and a half ago) I would have gave this place 4-5 stars. The food was great, the service was great, my friends and I loved it! Best Chinese food ever! 
Last night my husband and I went for dinner. It was my husbands first time there, and service was horrible. We were seated and then 2 other couples where seated next to us which was fine we don't mind sitting with strangers. We waited for a long time to get our order taken. The server actually asked the other people next to us first and we were there first. Just waiting.. 
The food was great, my husband and I loved the food. We ordered chow mein, shrimp with mushrooms, and some sort of orange chicken (I don't remember the name) 
To drink I ordered tea and my husband ordered water, which was tap (don't ask for water) 
When we were ready to leave and we asked for our check and boxes to go we had to ask literally 4 times. And again, while the people next to us were catered right away. They asked for their check and boxes to go after we asked and they got theirs first. It was seriously annoying lol 
(The people next us were really nice though.) 
My husband NEVER ever plays the black card. But he truly believes that because he is black, the waiters we're rude. (Everyone that works there is Asian ) And I agree. we were nice to the waiters, we weren't demanding, we didn't give the waiters a hard time, we were patient and just waited our turn. Which we should have!! My husband and I were really disappointed with the service , but not with the food.
I don't know if we'll ever come here again when we're in town. Maybe if we can't find another good Chinese food restaurant.
author: Ashley S.

description: The owner comes outside to attend the  outrageous line that starts at 5;15pm and says: " five beer???!!!" This place is sooo great.never order from the  menu just tell the  waitress to make whatever is special or good for the  evening and you won't go wrong. The oyster based yam dishes are spectacular! It truly is the whole enjoyable aspect of food in SF. You get good food,rude wait people devoid of cultural understanding who don't need you,foreigners from everywhere,noise,mess and all forms of people groups coupled with great smell,great food,view and you even get to.....or may have to share a seat or table with some women with armpit hair that uses no deodorant but is really sexy anyway.....somehow! This place rocks it all and is affordable as well! I have been here 25 times.
author: Brian D.

description: Great food truly impressed from all the flavors.  I took my Latin golden girls and they loved it thank you
author: Carmen R.

description:
This place is awesome. To start with grab a local beer and an onion cake. I love the chicken entree they have as well as the fried rice. Its not the most expensive chinese food too. The only downside which can also be a pro for this place is the seating arrangement. Downside because its too packed all the time and you may end up sharing tables and the pro is that s how authentic chinese places back in china are, small and packed and very fast. Def one of my fav city restaurant. 

PS - this comes from someone whose not a big meat person. So onion cakes for sure with a beer and black pepper chicken. Cheers
author: Parth V.

description: Man I should have thoroughly read the reviews before waiting in the cold just to be met with mediocre, small-portioned, high-priced Chinese food.  The blooming tea - sure - it's pretty entertaining to pay $3 to see a flower basically grow in your cup. But the food quality and price? Not worth my cup of tea at all. We ordered: Sesame Chicken, Garlic Noodles, Pork Dumplings, Scallops, Eggplant, Fried Rice, and Chow Mein. My taste buds didn't woo or aww and the service was nothing close to exceptional either. Definitely a tourist trap... I wouldn't come back, sorry!
author: Jasmine G.

description:
A can't-miss if you're in San Francisco. It's a small restaurant but they find ways to squeeze you in even when it's pretty full. 

I've never ordered from the menu, only ever let them know my preferences (seafood and vegetables okay, no meat) and let them choose for me. This has always yielded fantastic results! I will never forget the veggie dumplings we once had with mixed vegetables and cilantro. 

I went in for lunch recently and even as early as noon, it was decently crowded. It's impossible to deny that the service is the best you'll ever have but they are attentive even if they aren't necessarily friendly. Some waitstaff are less grumpy than others, it just depends on who you have but I really could care less. They do their job, they are extremely responsive, and they bring you fantastic food. I had salt and pepper shrimp with mushrooms that was delicious but so so spicy -- I almost had to go get a glass of milk. I always order blooming tea with  my meal.
author: Kira W.

description: The best..crispy, smoky green beans, calamari, slivered sweet potatoes coated with a divine sauce, tea, onion cake, sesame chicken, and lettuce wraps!  Fast service for 6 hungry kids and a full restaurant.
author: Marilee K.

description: Popular tourist destination in the North Beach/ Chinatown area.  Lines can be long at standard meal times, but the specials menu which contains a list of meals for less than $10 is a tasty thing to check out. Off of that, the crispy short ribs and Nanking chicken are my favorites here. *CASH ONLY*
author: AustinSLin ..

description: I can't say that the food is the worst, but I can say that their customer service is. They are extremely rude and don't know how to threat their customers. They also get upset when you order "tea" because they are alway out of it, but it so happens to be on the menu??
author: Raffi E.

description: i enjoyed the food here very much. they service is very in a hurry. sit order pay now leave. they are polite in their own way. you can tell they have limited time and staff. we didnt have to wait long to be seated. there was a line building up outside. we were sat as a party of 2 at a table of 6. this place is rather small and doesnt give a lot of seating arrangement options. there was a party of 3 seated at our very same table. it was weird at first but the staff seemed to stay aware of the separation in parties. food and prices were exceptional. yumm :)
author: Amy B.

description: Best Chinese food I have had in SF, it's a delight for vegetarians also.  The onion cake appetizer is a must have, so is the chow mein. We tried almost all veg entrees and they were all delicious. Few notable once are tofu in black sauce, eggplant in garlic sauce and fried rice.
author: Chetas M.

description: Always wondered why this place is always packed with people waiting outside, finally tried it and omg the food is unbelievably bad. Everything tastes like its been soaked in the same overly sweet and starchy sauce, and drenched in oil. And it's pricey for what tastes worse than Panda Express in an airport. It's a tourist trap, I don't think anyone is a return customer here. Save yourself and your wallet and go next door to house of xian dumplings. No wait, half the price, much tastier and more authentic Chinese food.
author: Hao L.

description: I have been going to this place for a long time and love it. It's a small place crowed, but the food is awesome. I travel 2 hours just to eat there. Great place
author: Raven S.

description: Best chinese food by far in San Francisco! I could eat here everyday and never get tired of the Lettuce wraps and the pots tickers. The price is very affordable and fast service. My only complaint is that I don't  live next store. Put this on your to do list and make sure you email me and let me know what you think.
author: Lisa D.

description:
Not a bad place. I've always thought this was one of those tourists trap places so I avoided it. Pleasantly surprised that the food was actually pretty good. They also serve beer & wine.

Can't remember exactly what we ordered but the noodles were good, beef and green onions had really good flavor, and the veggies were good.
author: Linda C.

description: This is one of the famous Chinese restaurants in town. You have to wait in line to get in. The Sesame Chicken is totally worth it.
author: Danny B.

description: I was caught a bit off guard by the atmosphere, but as soon as I forgave the offensive attitude of the workers, I had a ton of fun, and a delicious meal.
